Title: AtomEncd
Description: A GUI interface for creating custom ADX and HCA audio files using CriAtomEncoder.

Title: PersonaFont
Description: A tool to decompress and recompress Persona 3, 4 and 5's .FNT files.

Title: P4G Save Editor
Description: Edits decrypted savedata bin files dumped from P4G.

Title: RMD Maxscript
Description: A tool for loading model and animation data from RMDs in 3DSMax. Extract the included scripts, EXE and folder to the same directory together to extract textures when loading the model. Can be used with Amicitia for model hacking, but make sure to export with the axis set to Z-up instead of Y-up.

Title: BFMessageScriptEditor
Description: tool for extracting and replacing BMD files within BF scripts (as decompiled MSG files) without the need for recompiling the BF itself. Useful as an alternative to the compiler to avoid issues when all you want to do is simple text edits.

Title: PKGView
Description: A program for extracting the contents of Playstation Network PKG files.

Title: CriPakGUI
Description: A GUI for extracting files from CPK archives.

Title: DCMovieCreator
Description: A tool for making custom SFD video files. Used for the animated cutscenes and openings.

Title: PuyoTools
Description: A tool for packing/unpacking ADX files in AFS Archives. Useful for cutscene voice clips and battle sounds.

Title: UMDGen
Description: A program for extracting and replacing files from PSP UMDs/ISOs.

Title: GMD/GFS/GAP Import Maxscript
Description: A maxscript for 3DSMax that allows you to import GMD models and GAP animations from Persona 5.
Update:
Update 12/14/2020:
v0.16:
- Added P5R key types (34 and 35, PSHalf and RSHalf).

Title: EVTTool
Description: Drag an EVT file from Persona 5's event folder onto this EXE to convert it to an editable JSON. Edit with your favorite text processor (like notepad++) and drag it back onto the EXE to convert it back to EVT.

Title: DDS2Tool
Description: A tool for extracting and building BIN files that contain DDS bustups.

Title: BustupParamEditor

Title: P4U2 Mod Tools
Description:
Includes:
bddata - bddata.bin extraction tools
p4u2mod - custom game update creation tool
patch - patch files for use with rpcs3

Title: PM1 Message Script Editor
Description: Unpacks and repacks text from PM1 (event) files as MSG files that you can edit.

Title: ACBEditor
Description: A tool for unpacking/repacking AWB audio archives using their corresponding ACB.

Title: P5 EPL Injector
Description: Drag an EPL file from Persona 5 onto this EXE to extract all GMD files. Drag a folder containing GMD files onto the EXE to repack the EPL file. Useful for editing effect models or All Out Attack images.

- Now you can edit elemental affinities for any Persona in UNIT.TBL!

Title: PQ CheatEngine Table
Description: A cheat table for Persona Q, for use while playing on Citra.

Title: GFDStudio
Description: A model viewer and editor for GMD/GFD files from various titles. Also supports editing and viewing animations in GAP files.

(Improves P5R custom model import compatibility)

Title: EVTEditor
Description: A GUI for editing events in Persona 5 Using EVTTool, AtlusScriptCompiler & AtlusFileSystemLibrary by TGEnigma

Title: PS4 Bustup Repacker
Description: Unpacks and repacks Persona 5 (PS4)'s bustup BINs. Drag a folder containing PS4 Bustup BINs onto this EXE to Unpack OR Drag an unpacked folder containing GNF files onto this EXE to Repack

Title: Persona5NameTableEditor
Description: You can use this to edit strings in the NAME.TBL until a better solution comes along. Only works with unedited Persona 5 NAME.TBL for now.

Title: PQ2 CheatEngine Table
Description: A cheat table for Persona Q2, for use while playing on Citra.

Title: io_plg
Description: A Blender Import-Export addon for the PLG format mesh collections found in some Atlus games. With this script you can import a PLG file to a blender mesh collection, or export a mesh collection to a PLG file.

Title: BustupParamEditorGUI
Description: New version of BustupParamEditor that allows you to change the values for X and Y positioning of the mouth, eyes, or the entire bustup. You can also add/rename entries, create new bustup .bin files, and repack edited images back into P5's bustup .bin format.
Update:
Update 11/15/2019:
- Allow adding/renaming entries, creating new .bin files
- Automatically tries to recover last param/bustup dir path at startup
- Uses values from param file to select bustups now instead of static list of names
- Appends new entries to selected params file
- Can now create .bins for param entries that lack one
- Can now rename existing/unused entries instead of adding them

Title: P4G Mod Support
Description:
Includes (for P4G US/JP):
- a patch that enables mod.cpk support (no more repacking 1.8GB data.cpk every single time)
- an intro skip patch
- an auto patching script
- a mod that serves as an indicator to see if mod.cpk support is enabled + fixes an annoying bug in US P4G's title screen (in Mod Compendium and prepackaged form)
Update:
Note:
Use this custom build of the Mod Compendium for now to make mod.cpk files for P4G.

Title: 010 Editor GFD Template
Description: 010 Editor Template for GMD/GFS/BED/EPL/EPT/BFL. Now with full support for EPL.

Title: RPCS3PatchEboot
Description: Application that applies patches in a RPCS3 patch.yml file and applies it to the EBOOT file directly.
Update:
Update 1/20/2020:
- Support for Vita EBOOT/ELFs
- Misc. bug fixes
- Support for tabs
- Support for decimal numbers

Title: Persona 5 Cutin Tool
Description:
Tool for packing and decompressing the Persona 5 Cutin .dds images. Ported from this Python script by yukinogatari: https://github.com/yukinogatari/Reverse-Engineering/blob/master/Persona%205/p5_unpack.py
Usage: P5CutinTool cutinDir
Update:
Update 2/3/2020:
Now supports recompressing cutins thanks to rxys.

Title: P5R Animation Backport (GFDStudio Fork)
Description: GFD Studio Fork that will automatically convert P5R Animations to be loadable in P5 vanilla. It's still not in a release state so you'll need to compile it by yourself to test it. But I believe some people might be interested with it :)

Title: xacttool
Description:
WIP tool for extracting/modifying XWB files.


Known issues
- Extracting some XWB files crashes the program such as ROOT.xwb. You can alternatively use unxwb for this.

Usage
Replaces BGM019/index 20 with BGM019.wav with the loop information set:
xacttool -wb ""BGM.xwb"" -r ""BGM019.wav"" -ls 717056 -le 4511872
Extracts the waves from the XWB file:
xacttool -wb ""BGM.xwb"" -x

Title: Persona 4 Golden Save Converter
Description:
https://github.com/zarroboogs/p4g-saveconv

convert_vita2pc.py is a utility that converts P4G PS Vita saves to P4G PC saves:
  • PS Vita data00XX.bin and system.bin files are converted to the PC format (see FAQ #1 in README.md).
  • PS Vita sdslot.dat file is converted to PC data00XX.binslot files (see FAQ #2 in README.md).
This tool will convert the above into proper PC .bin/.binslot files.

There's no need to edit any hashes manually.

convert_pc2vita.py is a utility that converts P4G PC saves to P4G PS Vita saves by reversing the actions described above.

WARNING: REMEMBER TO BACKUP YOUR SAVES BEFORE USING THIS TOOL.

Title: P5 Table Editor
Description: This is a command line tool that leets you edit any ftd file, at least from p5 I don't know if any other games uses it.
Update: Update 1.3: -Add support for ftd version 1 files (because apparently that it's a thing.) If you tried it before and got garbage output try now.

Title: Persona 4 Golden CheatEngine Table
Description: A cheat table for the PC version of Persona 4 Golden.

Title: PackTools
Description:
Commandline tools by TGE for extracting and repacking various archives.
ACXPack: pack, unpack, or replace contents of ACX files
DDS3Pack: pack, unpack, or replace contents of DDS3's img/ddt
LBPack: pack, unpack, or replace contents of LB files
PakPack: pack, unpack, or replace contents of PAK/PAC/BIN files
DDS3Pack: pack, unpack, or replace contents of SMT1's DATA.BIN
Update: Update 7/8/2020: Fix PAK v2 & v3 not being aligned correctly

Title: Amicitia
Description: A multi-use tool for hacking Persona games. Can open a variety of different Atlus formats, such as: TMX, SPR, PAC/BIN and RenderWare formats: RMD and TXD. Use this to make custom textures or import custom models!
Update:
Update 7/12/2020: BVP & Field pac editing bug fixes & improvements
Update 7/10/2020: PAK: fix stream being closed after saving
Update 6/22/2020: Fix TMX alpha not being scaled properly, Fix ""Cannot access a closed file"" bug when opening AMD files , Allow resaving and editing of TMX ""UserId"" values used to correctly rendering some graphics

Title: Binary Templates
Description: Templates for 010 Editor that makes editing various formats easier.

Title: p4gpc.modloader
Description: A mod loader for the Steam version of Persona 4 Golden, using Reloaded II for DLL injection. See the readme for more information.
Update:
Update 11/2/2020 (Development): CPK Redirection (use folder named cpk_e for mods instead of data00004 etc.) use preappfile to dump files referenced by cpk rather than extract PAKs.
Update 7/10/2020: Log to p4gpc.modloader.log.txt in the P4G installation folder when the console is enabled

Title: P4GMOdelConverter
Description: A tool for creating working P4G custom models. Converts FBX and GMO models to MDS (an editable text format) and back, with support for correcting issues that prevent custom models from rendering correctly in P4G. You can also optionally dump TM2 textures and quickly re-order animations.
Update: 7/23/2020 : Added PC Support, Animation management, viewing and conversion options

Title: Atlus Script Tools
Description:
WIP set of tools developed for handling Atlus' script formats including:
flow script files (.bf)
message script files (.bmd)
This can be used to change/add dialog to several Atlus games that use BF/BMD (including Persona 4 & 5) and also modify the scripts that control certain aspects of the game like events, enemy AI etc.
Update:
Update 11/23/2020: - Fix variable indices when importing compiled flowscripts
Update 11/3/2020: - Fix negative float values being saved incorrectly to the file, Improve writing of large operands, add P5R efigs encoding
Update 2/11/2020: Add P3 & P3 FES libraries

Title: PersonaRandomizer (Beta)
Description: A largely untested WIP tool meant to randomize TBL values in Persona games. P5's ENCOUNT.TBL should work for randomized encounters.

Title: Mod Compendium
Description: Easily create, combine and install multiple mods for Persona 3, 4, 5, P3P, P4G, P5R, PQ, PQ2, Catherine Full Body and the Dancing games.
Update:
Update 1/11/2021: Add P5R EUR support, add patches by lipsum for USA mod support and JP/USA intro skipUpdate 12/20/2020: Add P5R USA support
Update 9/30/2020: Add P5R Update PKG Creation
Update 6/22/2020: Add P4G PC Support
Update 4/12/2020: Fix P3/4 patching, add HostFS output, add option to sort mods by subfolder

Title: preeappfile (P4G PC CPK Tool)
Description:
Archive (un)packer and code library for games developed by Preapp Partners, including the PC ports of Persona 4 Golden and the Neptunia games.

Usage instructions:
Drag and drop a CPK/PAC file onto preappfile to unpack.
Drag and drop a folder onto preappfile to pack it into a CPK and PAC file(s).
For further usage instructions, run preappfile with the '-h' or '--help' argument.

Title: Aemulus Package Manager
Description: No longer will you have to manually merge conflicting bin files found in different mods. This is the latest and greatest mod package manager, made specifically for Persona 4 Golden on PC (as well as P3FES, P5 and P5S). See Source for how to use.

Title: Unofficial P5R 010 Template
Description: 010 Template for editing TBL files in Persona 5 Royal.

Title: P5 Character Swapper
Description:
A program that automatically replaces one character's models and animations with another. It attempts to match up outfit IDs and falls back to a default model (051 by default) if no match is found.
You can also optionally retarget models or animations from one character to another.

Title: AtlusScriptCompiler GUI
Description: Erase the hassle of using commandline arguments! Place this program in the same directory as AtlusScriptCompiler.exe and run it. You can select a game, drag BF/BMD files into the window, and let the GUI handle compiling. Likewise, you can convert FLOW/MSG back to BF/BMD by dragging. Optionally supports overwriting, showing the log, hooking commands and disassembly. Thanks to Tupelov for implementing the dark theme and several other needed features and bugfixes.

Title: CPK TMX Tool
Description: Extracts/Replaces TMX files from special CPK files found in the PS2 Persona Games.

Title: Persona 5 Strikers PC Save Utility
Description:
Decrypts/encrypts P5S PC saves
Converts P5S PC saves from/to Switch JP format
Update: Update 2/20/2021: Added conversion from/to Switch EN format.

Title: P4 Adachi Navigator

Title: P3FES Playable Adachi

costume.

Title: Door-Kun
Description: You already know who it is.

Description: You already know who it is.

Description: Replaces unused field f000_100 with a model of Iwatodai dormitory

Title: Zero Two Costume for Futaba
Description: Zero Two Costume for Futaba Zero Two costume from Darling in the Franxx. Model created by Chiba-Taiki

Title: P3 Reincarnation (Alt BGM Mod)

Title: P4 Custom Sub Menu
Description:
Notable Features:
- Choose a Field, Dungeon Floor, Battle, Event, Cutscene, BGM Track, Dungeon or Facility to load
- Toggle individual bitflags or entire ranges of them
- Change the in-game date and time
- Change your rank with any confidant, add money or items
Optional Extensions:
- QuickTravelPlus (extended quicktravel options in Yasogami High and around the town of Inaba)- SaveAnywhere by Tupelov
- FindAFriend by AnimatedSwine37
- IntroSkip (In-game option to skip the long introduction events of the game by starting at 4/20)
Update: Update 3/7/2020: Added Intro Skip mod, updated Find A Friend

Title: P4 Free Camera
Description: Unlimited camera control on every map.

Title: P5 Custom Music Edition
Description: A mod that changes many of the tracks in not only the main OST, but also changes all the costume DLC battle themes. Track List

Description: This mod replaces the last few ranks of the Priestess, Empress, and Lovers social links for the FeMC with the corresponding ones from the MMC.

Title: P4 Reincarnation (Alt BGM Mod)
Description: A mod that replaces most of the OST tracks with new official arrangements released after the game.

Title: P3 Full Moonlight
Description: A combination of the Rebirth Cutscenes (P3 movie scenes adapted to original game cutscene dub) and Reincarnation BGM mods (alternate OST).

Title: Rebirth Cutscenes
Description: This mod replaces almost all cutscenes in P3 FES The Journey with entirely new ones. Edited together using clips from the Persona 3 Movie series and audio from the original English dub of the game.

Title: P5D USA Asset Patch
Description: Patch for the Japanese version of P5D with the English assets from the Western Version. You need rePatch and the latest game update (1.03) to run them. Readme included!

Title: P3D USA Asset Patch
Description: Patch for the Japanese version of P3D with the English assets from the Western Version. You need rePatch and the latest game update (1.03) to run them. Readme included!

Description: Edit prebuild.bat with the proper paths to EVTTool and PAKPack in order to automatically compile edited event JSONs and test the results before the title screen even loads.

Title: MC Hoodie for Field Outfitss
Description: This mod replaces the MC's casual outfits and school uniforms with the hoodie from later in the game. The outfit is retextured for the school uniforms to match up with the default look.

Title: Akechi Valentine's Day Date
Description: This is a demo for a gay romance mod that is still in progress.

Title: Scalable/Redrawn Bustups (RPCS3 Fix)
Description: This mod fixes the notorious bustup scaling issue for P5 on RPCS3. Unlike previous iterations of this fix, this mod does not have any annoying lines appearing when a character blinks or talks. These bustups were slightly ""redrawn"" and edited, so that the problem no longer occurs.

Title: Persona 5 Unmasked
Description: A mod that removes the masks from all party members' Phantom Thief outfits. Includes edited models and bustups. Note: Not all HUD elements have masks removed yet.
Update:
Update v1.1 (3/8/2019):
Changes courtesy of DeathChaos. Removed black face texture when using Persona skills in battle. Fixed Yusuke's hair clipping into his face.

Title: Alternate Battle Models
Description: A pack of replacement battle models that really should have been DLC.
Update:
Update v1.1 (3/10/2019):
Fixes a crash when entering battle using the Beta Protagonist outfit. Adds the hoodie to the protagonist's battle outfits.

Title: Playable Link (BotW)
Description:
This mod will let you play as Link from Breath of the Wild.
Specifically it replaces all of Jokers models with 5 Models of Link. It also replaces various images of Joker with Link.

Title: FeMC over Fuuka
Description: Replaces Fuuka's default appearance with FeMC from P3P. Shoutout to Jinsters on DeviantArt for the hair and headphones models.

Title: 346/3 Days
Description:
This is a Kingdom Hearts themed mod that replaces Joker, Ryuji, Morgana (Metaverse), and Ann with Roxas, Lea, Moogle XIII, and Xion. Most of the characters art have been replaced and 22 songs have been replaced with Kingdom Hearts songs..

Thanks to LexaKiness for Roxas, Lea, and Xion's models. Thanks to Zerox for the Moogle XIII model.

Title: All-Out-Attack Testing Mod
Description:
This should make it a snap to quickly test changes to All Out Attack renders for any character.
1. Edit prebuild.bat with the paths to PAKPack and AtlusScriptCompiler
2. Edit this mod's Data/field/fini_000_002.bf.flow according to which party members you want (should be fairly straightforward)
3. Build the mod from the Mod Compendium and it will automatically compile the BF and repack the PAC!

Title: PQ2 BGM
Description: A small mod that replaces a few FES bgm tracks with music from PQ2.

Title: Espaï¿½ol font for P5
Description: Mod that adds special spanish characters to the P5 font for spanish translated mods

Title: PQ2 MC Name Patch
Description: A set of assembly patches (patched in thanks to Magikoopa) for Persona Q2 (USA) that patches out the player name functions to allow the longer ""canon"" names that normally the player cannot fit into the name input box such as Yu Narukami to display via hardcoded name calls the same way other characters do.

Title: Talk Animation Fix
Description:
A bug in the English localization of PQ2 causes protagonists' mouths to no longer animate during voiced cutscenes.

This mod is meant to fix that bug. Note: this hasn't been heavily tested yet, so if you encounter any issues, let us know.

Title: Mementos Tziah Block Mod
Description: Replaces the standard Mementos Theme with the Tartarus theme from Persona 3.

Title: P3N: Naoto Mod
Description: Play as a different blue haired, gun wielding orphan in Persona 3. This mod replaces all of the MC's field/NPC models and the one-handed sword battle models, as well as most menu images.

Title: P5 Final Boss Music Edits
Description: Replaces the final battle themes in P5 with ""The Battle for Everyone's Souls"" and ""Hymn of the Soul"". Also replaces the boss theme during the traitor fight with ""Ying-Yang,"" and ""Fate is in Our Hands"" in battles where Rivers in the Desert would play.

Title: Take Over Battle Theme
Description: Replaces Last Surprise with Take Over from Persona 5 Royal.

Title: Deathwish
Description: This mod increases the stats of most enemies and changes the AI of bosses past the 5th Palace. Regular enemies and Mementos bosses will have their attributes (St, Ma, En, Lu, Ag) increased and their HP multiplied. Moreover, Mementos missions and Palace bosses will yield much more EXP and yen than usual. If you consider using it, I recommend you play on Merciless difficulty: the x3 multipliers on Critical and Technical hits shorten the fight with high HP enemies.

Title: Last Surprise Swimwear
Description: This swaps Ann's, Makoto's and Futaba's normal swim wear models to that of the ones used in the Last Surprise video. It's a simple model swap, but it's nice to be able to use these outfits in-game.

Title: Megalovania BGM
Description: This mod replaces all BGM with Megalovania or Megalovania remixes

Title: Dante and Vergil Joker Recolors
Description: Remember Joker's meme using the Dante and Vergil from Devil May Cry series scheme colors because of their alternate colors in Smash Ultimate? This is a mod based on that.

Title: Orpheus Telos Mod
Description: Replaces Orpheus Picaro with Orpheus Telos.

Title: All-in-One Battle Portraits
Description:
Replaces the black background of the battle UI with a sprite instead of a PLG, neatly rearranged for easy editing of party member icons.

The included PLG has the original vectors dummied out, shout out to Yangster for discovering the trick

Title: Darkechi PLG Icons
Description:
A version of the ""Darkechi Replacer"" mod that uses lipsum's io_plg to render the P5R Akechi battle icons as vectors.

Benefits: Scales to any resolution without artifacting and changes color with status effects. Use the included patch.yml for alignment fixes.

Title: No Glasses for Ren (Hair Swap)
Description: Replaces the Unmasked Thief hair model with the default hair model, since he doesn't wear glasses with this model.

Title: Ann Red Gloves
Description: Here is a simple mod which changes the color of Ann's gloves from ugly pink to nice dark red.

Title: Darkechi Replacer
Description: Replaces Akechi's in-battle animations with his boss animations, tints his sword red, gives him new voice lines, changes several Mementos bustups, adds new dialog when adding him to the team and works with every costume. Designed to work with the Alternate Costumes Mod by ShrineFox.
Update:
Update 11/3/2019:
-Multiple improvements by the author, see included readme.txt

Title: Persona 5 Music Overhaul
Description: This mod aims to spice up the soundtrack of Persona 5 for a more definitive experience, similar to the Full Moonlight Edition mod for Persona 3 FES. It currently includes songs from Persona 5 Royal, Persona 5: Dancing in Starlight, Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth, and Persona 5 the Animation. Song List

Title: Usable Loki
Description:
This mod gives Loki a complete Skill tree!
This is an early version of the mod so you can currently only access Loki by using the Amicitia mod menu (Add Persona/L/Loki 219). Loki's weaknesses and resistances are now completely original

Title: No Annoying Navigator
Description: This mod silences the most repetitive voice lines from Makoto and Morgana during fights. Works only for japanese voices.

Title: PS2 P4 Opening
Description: The PS2 opening movie exists in the game files under the name ""P4CTOP1.MP4"" and you can just decrypt that and use rePatch to direct to it when the game calls for the actual file. Of course, this will have the side effect of the P4G opening movie playing in the TV guide thingy.

Title: P4 with P4G Chie Voices
Description: A mod that replaces all of Chie's voices with her newly re-voiced P4G clips.
Update:
Update 2.0: Qlonever kindly fixed several errors with the original mod!
NOTE: When building a new ISO with the Mod Compendium, manually delete ZZZZZ.BIN before replacing the DATA.CVM and SLUS_217.82 to ensure that the ISO saves properly.

Title: The Big Persona 5 Music Mod

Title: Persona 4 hostFS Patch
Description:
Replace/Add files to the CVMs without repacking.
1. Edit PCSX2_vm.ini inside the PCSX2 ini folder and change the line with 'HostFs=disabled' to 'HostFs=enabled'.
2. Extract the SLUS from the ISO and add the .ELF extension to it.
3. Place replacement files in a folder named after the CVM, which goes in the same directory as the .ELF.
4. Load the game's ISO in PCSX2 (with cheats enabled), and then select ""Run ELF"" from the ""File"" menu.

Title: Persona 3 FES hostFS Patch
Description:
Replace/Add files to the CVMs without repacking.
1. Edit PCSX2_vm.ini inside the PCSX2 ini folder and change the line with 'HostFs=disabled' to 'HostFs=enabled'.
2. Extract the SLUS from the ISO and add the .ELF extension to it.
3. Place replacement files in a folder named after the CVM, which goes in the same directory as the .ELF.
4. Load the game's ISO in PCSX2 (with cheats enabled), and then select ""Run ELF"" from the ""File"" menu.

Title: Nocturne hostFS Patch
Description:
Replace/Add files to the dds3.img and MOVIE folder without repacking.
1. Edit PCSX2_vm.ini inside the PCSX2 ini folder and change the line with 'HostFs=disabled' to 'HostFs=enabled'.
2. Extract the SLUS from the ISO and add the .ELF extension to it.
3. Extract contents of dds3.img and MOVIE to a folder named ""dds3data"", which goes in the same directory as the .ELF.
4. Load the game's ISO in PCSX2 (with cheats enabled), and then select ""Run ELF"" from the ""File"" menu.

Title: Slightly Enhanced FMV Mod
Description: The goal of this mod is to make the FMV videos look slightly better however there is only so much that can be done in its current state. For some reason I will never understand atlus decided to encode the FMVs in game with the WMV2 Codec rather than the much more modern AVC codec used for the psvita version of the game. This results in some really bad compression and blocking which in some cases can be distracting. So I decided to use vapoursynth to try my best to fix it up. The results are not perfect as there is a small amount of detail loss and blockiness however in my opinion the results are much better than the originals. If you are interested in it I left the script I used for vapoursytnh as well as my ffmpeg settings in the readme.

Title: Remastered Cutscenes Pack
Description:
This mod aims to provide an improved visual experience.

FEATURES
- Completely new .USM files that have been reassembled and re-encoded from upscales of the original, Japanese PS Vita files
- Frame rates restored to (native) 29.97 FPS - an improvement over the initial PC version's 15 FPS files (REV 2008)
- Original aspect ratio restored, fixing the cropped (and in the beta, stretched) images present in the original PC videos
- Improved noise reduction with manually re-edited transitions and fades
- Redrawn text sequences (e.g. the opening disclaimer, ""Characters, art and storylines depicted..."")
- English and Japanese language tracks retained from the original PC files

Title: Costume Dialog Mod (WIP)
Description:
This mod restores the unused costume dialogue found in P5R, which has been translated from the originally-Japanese text to English, thanks to the efforts of various fan translators and editors.
The unused script originally also had no portraits except for the neutral one; these have been edited with portraits to better fit the dialogue. Keep in mind that this is a fan translation of unused dialogue.
Note that the only dialogue that has been fully translated, edited, and coded into this mod so far is for Haru, Yusuke, and Makoto, due to the differing speeds at which different translators and editors work. This mod is a beta/work in progress, and will be updated for the other characters when possible. (The next party member to be updated with translated dialogue is Ann.)
To use it, with an outfit equipped (on Joker and/or any of the party members), talk to any one of your party members at the dungeon entrance (not safe rooms) and select ""How's the clothes?"" (this option only pops up if Joker or the party member has a non-default costume equipped).

I have tried to maintain the same tone of the game's original audio, but this has not been thoroughly tested, so let me know if you think any of the songs don't fit the scenario where they play.

Title: Product Sans Font for Persona 5
Description: Changes the UI font to Google's Product Sans.

Title: Shadow Pog
Description: Poggers in chat

Title: Colorful Cutins
Description: Adds each characters thematic color to the background of their own cutin portraits. Inspired by and based off of theflightofarobyn's video.

Title: P3FES Font
Description: Replaces the main font of the game with P3FES's.

Title: Persona 5 Royal Mod Menu
Description: A multi-purpose custom menu that gets loaded when you press the Square button. Edit cameras, flags, the calendar, player stats, personas and skills-- as well as view animations, models, fields, events and more.
Update: Update 1.1: Adds English UI and uses English field/dungeon text. Descriptions don't match at the moment, will be fixed in the next update

Title: Joker's More Smug Idles
Description: Changed real world MC to have no hands in his pockets and changes Metaverse MC to stand straighter (and look more smug)

Title: P5 Minecraft Skin Mod
Description: A mod replacing Joker with a minecraft character with the ability to change the skin.

Title: P3 Master Chief
Description: Replaces mc battle models with Low-poly Chief

Title: High Quality Soundtrack Mod
Description: High Quality Music replacement mod for Persona 3 FES.

Title: Persona 5 Royal Patches
Description: A set of Persona 5 Royal patches

Title: An EPIC Persona 4 Golden Music Mod
Description:
This music mod includes tracks from Persona 4 Dancing, Persona 4 Reincarnation, The Persona 4 Animes, Persona 3(FES/Portable) Persona Q, Persona Q2, Super Smash Bros. Ultimate and even some Fan-Made music from Ode Imaginations and from the Re: Brilliance album.
Tracklist

Title: Persona 3 Dancing Tracks for Persona 3 FES
Description: Replaces some of the tracks with the versions that play in Persona 3 Dancing in Moonlight

Title: P3P Cut-Ins
Description: Replaces the cut-ins in P3Fes with the cut-ins from P3

Title: E.P.I.C (Epic Partypanel In Color)
Description: This EPIC mod, changes the textures from the P5 partypanel to colorful version of the battle portraits.

Title: Sonic Music Pack
Description: Replaces almost all the music with music from various Sonic games.

Title: P3D/P5D Kaleidoscopes for Persona 5
Description: Mods that replace the P5 Kaleidoscope texture for the border UI from the Persona 3/5 Dancing games.

Title: P3P: The Shadow Hour
Description: Welcome to P3P: The Shadow Hour! An issue I've always had with this game was how your party always seemed to outclass the enemies, which I would assume is because the game wasn't rebalanced with the new features in mind. This mod attempts to rectify this, at least somewhat, by making the enemies retain their competition against you throughout the game.
Update:
UPDATE (2/1/2021):
- Corrected some typos in the changes.txt
- Corrected affinities of some Red Shadows that were missed
- Included an Anti-Tedium Add-On that's meant to mitigate some of the boring, needless grinding, particularly for money and materials. Details on what was changed is included in the changes.txt.

Title: Black Mask Intruder MC
Description: Become Black Mask Intruder as protagonist in the awesome JRPG game Persona 5! Save the world from its doom!! https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/799560416874463232/803233028943773706/unknown.png https://mega.nz/file/6OQFDQCR#wbu3I-iXii7gnEOJWFDbqrltBd-GHPeO2KuyS67AbBY

Title: Persona 3 FES BGM Remix
Description: Changes tracks in ""The Journey"" with those from P1, P2. PQ, PQ2, P3D, and P4D

Title: P4G P3MC Mod
Description: Replaces Yu with P5R P3MC (DniweTamp's mod just for p4g)

Title: Runescape Font Mod
Description: Mod that replaces P4G's font for the Runescape_uf font.

Title: Persona 5 Battle Theme Swap
Description: Inspired by wxnder's ""Persona 2 Innocent Sin Battle Tracks."" Changes P3FES' battle themes with ones from P5R/P5S.

Title: Persona 5 Strikers BGM Mod
Description: This mod changes some P5 music tapes for P5S music tapes.

Title: Yosuke Hanamura over Ryoji mod
Description: Replaces all of Ryoji's scenes with Yosuke, including portraits, all models, animations and a few lines. Yes, this is all because of a voice actor joke. Enjoy.

Title: Thomas Mask For Joker
Description: thomas poggers. Adds a Thomas the Train Mask over Joker's head, with a crappy custom All-Out-Attack. Can be removed by deleting battle folder in the mod.

Title: [PC] Epic Partypanel In Color -Strikers Edition-
Description: This EPIC mod, changes the ol' partypanel sprites from Persona 5 Strikers to a more colorful version of them.

Title: E.P.I.C (Epic Partypanel In Color) -Royal Edition-
Description: The P5R partypanel was lacking some major drip, so I made this mod. It adds a new colored version of the character sprites that are used in battle.

Title: Epic Partypanel in Color -4K Edition-
Description: Epic Partypanel In Color - Now in 4k!

Title: Persona 5 RPCS3: Setup & Installing Mods
Description: This straightforward tutorial lists everything you need in order to run Persona 5 mods on RPCS3.

Title: Persona 5 RPCS3: Creating Mods
Description: Find out how to create your own Persona 5 mods using the Mod Compendium.

Title: Persona 5 EBOOT Patching
Description: This tutorial goes into detail on how to add patches from patch.yml to an EBOOT.BIN on a CFW PS3.

Title: Creating Custom SFX/Music in P5
Description: Learn how to create your own custom background music or sound effects in Persona 5.

Title: Adding Randomized Battle Tracks to Persona 5 (PS3)
Description: This is an advanced tutorial on adding extra DLC music tracks to the game and shuffling them randomly between battles using an EBOOT modification.

Title: Loading GMD Models and Animations in 3DSMax
Description: This guide explains how to load GMD models and GAP animations properly in 3dsmax (including models from the Dancing games)

Title: Loading Modded Files in Persona 3/4 (PS2)
Description: This guide describes the process of unpacking and repacking your ISO and CVM files using the Mod Compendium.

Title: Modding Using HostFS on PCSX2 (P3/P4/SMT3)
Description: This guide explains how to mod P3, P4, and SMT3 without ever needing to repack your ISO.

Title: Modding Persona 5 Royal on PS4 FW 5.05, 6.72 & 7.02
Description: A full walkthrough for generate modded P5R Updates using the Mod Compendium and exploiting the PS4 to install them.

Title: Extracting and Replacing P3P Battle Cut-In .EPL Files
Description:
(Works for P3P, Persona 4, and probably P3 and P4 Golden)
(Thanks to narcku giving a mini-tutorial for extracting .epl files here: https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/amicitia/persona-3-portable-narukami-mod-t1182-s40.html

Title: Debug Log
Description: This cheat prints string output from the game's original debug functions into the PCSX2 log. TGE's modification also prints the filename and path of each file the game accesses in real time, which is extremely helpful for finding and narrowing down the location of assets like models, fields etc.
Update:
// Enable debug log by TGE

patch=1,EE,00503768,word,00000000 // always branch even if not debug
patch=1,EE,005CDE83,byte,0A // patch file load print string
patch=1,EE,00100DAC,word,0C14896A // patch file load function call to debug print

Description: This cheat grants you an extra menu option in Tartarus that can be used to skip to the next floor or return to the entrance.

Title: Debug Calendar Mode
Description: This cheat allows you to select a date and time of day from a calendar overlay by pressing Select.

Title: Gain EXP x4095 (Whole Party)
Description: This cheat multiplies the EXP you earn from battle by 4095. Use this to quickly reach level 99.

Title: All Social Links Maxed
Description: This cheat maxes out the current level of each of your social links.

Title: All Personas in Compendium (Level 0)
Description: This cheat unlocks every Persona you can possibly buy from the compendium. They start at Level 0 but can be levelled up after one battle. Note: This overwrites previously registered Personas. Save and then stop using this code to continue registering your own Personas.

Title: No Level Limit When Fusing Persona
Description: This cheat removes the player level limitation when fusing Personas.
Update:

Title: Compendium Personas Cost No Money
Description: This cheat sets the cost to zero when summoning Personas from the Compendium.

Title: Analog Camera Control
Description: This makes camera turn speed dependent on how far you've pushed the analog stick. Normally the game only lets you turn once the stick passes a certain threshold at a fixed speed.
Update:
// ""processInput"" jump to patch code
patch=1,EE,001E05B0,word,08140d17 // j $50345C Jump to custom code that restores turn rate

// ""processInput"" fix sticks being offset by 128 instead of 127
patch=1,EE,001E073C,word,3c0242fe // lui v0, $42FE
patch=1,EE,001E07C4,word,3c0342fe // lui v1, $42FE
patch=1,EE,001E0844,word,3c0342fe // lui v1, $42FE
patch=1,EE,001E0898,word,3c0342fe // lui v1, $42FE

// ""processInput"" right stick left turn check, jump to patch code
patch=1,EE,001E09DC,word,3c03c120 // lui v1, $C120 Change deadzone to -10.0
patch=1,EE,001E09EC,word,08140d10 // j $503440 Jump to custom code that adjusts turn rate

// ""processInput"" right stick right turn check, jump to patch code
patch=1,EE,001E08B8,word,3c034120 // lui v1, $4120 Change deadzone to 10.0
patch=1,EE,001E08C8,word,08140cfc // j $5033F0 Jump to custom code that adjusts turn rate

// Patch custom turn code over some unused syscall wrappers

// Left turn hook
// $v1, $a0, $f0 and $f20 are free to use
// $f1 contains the right stick X axis as [-127, 128]
// -0x4AC4($gp) aka $B53C(gp) is turn rate
// Check if out of deadzone
patch=1,EE,00503440,word,45000005 // bc1f $5
// $f0 = $f1 / 64.0
patch=1,EE,00503444,word,3c03c1c0 // lui v1, $C1C0 $v1 = -24.0
patch=1,EE,00503448,word,44830000 // mtc1 v1, $f0 $f0 = v1
patch=1,EE,0050344C,word,46000803 // div.s $f0, $f1, $f0$f0 = $f1 / $f0
// $B53C(gp) *= f0
patch=1,EE,00503450,word,0807827d // j $1E09F4 return
patch=1,EE,00503454,word,e780b53c // swc1 $f0, $B53C(gp)$B53C(gp) = $f0
// outside of deadzone
patch=1,EE,00503458,word,080782ba // j $1E0AE8 return
patch=1,EE,0050345C,word,00000000 // nop

// Restore turn rate at the beginning of processInput
// $B53C(gp) = 4.0
patch=1,EE,0050345C,word,3c034080 // lui v1, $4080 $v1 = 4.0
patch=1,EE,00503460,word,af83b53c // sw v1, $B53C(gp) $B53C(gp) = v1
patch=1,EE,00503464,word,0807816d // j $1E05B4 return
patch=1,EE,00503468,word,27bdfed0 //Overwritten instruction

// Right turn hook
// $v1, $a0, $f0 and $f20 are free to use
// $f1 contains the right stick X axis as [-127, 128]
// -0x4AC4($gp) aka $B53C(gp) is turn rate
// Check if out of deadzone
patch=1,EE,005033F0,word,45010005 // bc1t $5
// $f0 = $f1 / 64.0
patch=1,EE,005033F4,word,3c0341c0 // lui v1, $41C0 $v1 = 24.0
patch=1,EE,005033F8,word,44830000 // mtc1 v1, $f0 $f0 = v1
patch=1,EE,005033FC,word,46000803 // div.s $f0, $f1, $f0$f0 = $f1 / $f0
// $B53C(gp) *= f0
patch=1,EE,00503400,word,08078234 // j $1E08D0 return
patch=1,EE,00503404,word,e780b53c // swc1 $f0, $B53C(gp)$B53C(gp) = $f0
// outside of deadzone
patch=1,EE,00503408,word,08078274 // j $1E09D0 return
patch=1,EE,0050340C,word,00000000 // nop

Title: Broken 60FPS
Description: This cheat forces the game to render 60 frames per second, however it breaks a lot of things that rely on accurate framecount for timing.

Title: Enable Debug Log
Description: This cheat prints string output from the game's original debug functions into the PCSX2 log. TGE's modification also prints the filename and path of each file the game accesses in real time, which is extremely helpful for finding and narrowing down the location of assets like models, fields etc. https://i.imgur.com/5I5Vos8.png

Title: Infinite SP
Description: Gives the main character (and party?) infinite SP.

Title: Enemies Fully Analyzed
Description: Enemies are already fully analyzed in battle while this code is enabled.

Title: Original Opening+
Description:
This mod allows you to swap FES opening when you boot up the game to enhanced and improved opening from vanila Persona 3. FES opening will still be in game, you can watch it when idling on title screen, or when player died.

Also i partially deinterpolated and enhanced the quality of the vanila opening. MUCH less atrifacts and better details with help of small sharpen filter.

Report of any issues with the mod on my discordÂ darlin#7311
I only tested it on 16:9 FullHD Monitor so i don't know what's going to happen on wider resolution like 21:10. 4:3 works fine too.

Title: Product Sans Font For Persona 3 FES
Description:
A replacement of all the text used in-game with the "Product Sans" font, most commonly used by Google.

Known Issues & Bugs

- Some text is misaligned. This much, I'm aware of. I'll be working on realigning some of the text in the future, as for now; the way it stands, the characters that ARE misaligned are less commonly used, and by that, it's often only by a few pixels.

Installation
As always, I will provide two ways of going about this, depending on your masochism levels.
Aemulus; the "easy" way, and manual, the hard way.

Easy Way (Using Aemulus)

The easy way is to use Aemulus, which you can download (if you don't have it) here.

After
it's installed, run through the setup by selecting your Output folder,
the ISO path, the ELF path, and then the path for PCSX2, after that--
just simply click the "one-click installation" and enable the package,
and then launch the .ELF that Aemulus builds for you.
The "Hard" Way (without Aemulus)

So, you're a masochist, huh?

Install
the fil ...

Title: P3F Community Enhancement Pack
Description:
P3F Community Enhancement Pack (P3F CEP) is an all-in-one collection of tools and mods for emulating the 2008 PS2 release of Persona 3 FES.

P3F CEP includesÂ several enhancement modsÂ that improve on the base game in a variety of ways. Whether it's improved textures, combat rebalancing, or just making textboxes prettier, these mods make for a better first or five hundredth playthrough of P3F.

There are also a fewÂ cheat sheet mods, intended to let players experience everything on repeat playthroughs without having to look up a guide.Â We don't recommend using these your first time playing!

P3F CEP includes theÂ Aemulus Package ManagerÂ program to make customization easy. All of the mods in P3F CEP can be individually enabled or disabled with Aemulus, and it's easy for users toÂ add additional modsÂ to their loadout without having to manually merge files.

P3F CEP isÂ fully compatible with unmodded P3F save dataÂ and does not affect story progression. You do not need to start a new game before ...

Description:
Have you ever wanted to play P3F in Widescreen on CONSOLE like hacked PS3s, PS4s or even PS2s, but you couldn't use the latest patch? Worry not, an updated version of this patch has been made for use on Console AND PC.

For Console users,
This should work with **PS2 Patch Engine, so you can patch your (legally obtained) ISO along withÂ Velvet Room BG Patch [Persona 3 FES] [Mods] (gamebanana.com)

I also recommend
Widescreen Fixes [Persona 3 FES] [GUI Mods] (gamebanana.com)

and both Cheat Sheets made for the game.
PSP Ui is also nice :DÂ P3P Style UI [Persona 3 FES] [GUI Mods] (gamebanana.com)

I'll be uploading a tutorial on how to actually patch these mods into an ISO for Console usage, as i've went through countless hours figuring this out.

For PC users, You're going to want to put this into the cheats folder in PCSX2. Do NOT turn on Widescreen Cheats in the PCSX2 settings, just Cheats. If you're using Velvet Room BG fix a ...

A patch that I made, this makes it so that instead of using a low resolution image, the game continues rendering out the velvet room.

Github

Title: Non-silent Protagonist
Description:
This is a simple mod that makes it so the protagonist will use the voice lines from the bow on the other weapons as well, adding more actual speaking and less screaming in combat.

Note: Support for Mod Compendium is planned.

Title: Escape Route Fuuka Always Available
Description: This is mainly for players who have already beaten the game and are either playing a New Game+ or are starting The Answer. Since you have to level up Fuuka again for escape route, I've decided to make it available from the start, since leaving Tartarus or a door in The Answer is always up to luck.  This cheat does not account for Mitsuru, since she is never supposed to learn this skill, so she does not have extra choices in Tartarus, like music, unlike Fuuka. You also can't check Mitsuru's skills when talking to her, so it would seem that some modding would have to be done to get this idea to work.

Title: New Moon Balance Patch
Description:
If you want to use an old save, read this first
IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO USE A SAVE FILE, USE THIS PROGRAM.

If you use New Game or New Game+ you do not have to use the Party Skill Editor.

Alternatively, you can use New Moon Liteâ¢. Lite contains all of the changes from New Moon, except the new party skills, so it is compatible with virtually every save if you aren't comfortable with the above workaround.

What is this?

Summary
The New Moon Balance Patch is an incredibly in-depth, massive overhaul of nearly every active skill, the entire party, and a handful of bosses in Persona 3 FES.

Despite this, New Moon manages to stay faithful to the original Persona 3 experience, carefully altering a variety of different aspects toward similar, yet absolutely superior, gameplay.

SKILL CHANGES:

â¢ Rebalanced HP cost and SP costs
â¢ Generally higher accuracy rates, with some exceptions
â¢ Higher critical rates for the majority of physical skills
â¢ Shock/ Freeze rates altered, under 100% for severe, h ...

Title: Skill Backport
Description:
Imports eleven skills from Persona 4 and 5, including two unused passives. Available in MSR v1.2, or via separate download here. If you want to use Modern Skill Rebalance, download v1.2 and not this.

Currently incompatible with Faithful Party Rebalance, which will receive a compatibility update in a day or two (didn't want to delay this any further lmao).

Complete patchnotes(only Backport/ MSRv1.2 New Skills tab)Â 

Also check out the video since I, y'know, put effort into it. Check out the cool animations.

Title: Modern Skill Rebalance
Description:
What is this?
This mod alters the attributes of many (82!) moves in Persona 3 to be more representative of their Persona 4/5 versions.Â 

â¢ v1.1 MSR now affects both The Journey and The Answer.
â¢ v1.2 incorporates the Skill Backport mod, along with some addition changes.
â¢ v1.25 adds Blazing Hell.

The original thumbnail was by the wonderful hanakomisa on the Henry-C discord.

Title: P3P Style UI
Description:
This mod changes some of the UI to be more like P3P's UI. Some of the UI elements seemed pretty outdated, like the Daytime UI and the Weekday UI. This mod is for everyone that also doesn't like the old UI and prefers the UI from P3P

Some elements couldn't be changed, like the "Weak" "Block" and "Critical' battle elements. The location ui also couldn't be changed without it having issues

If you have any questions or issues about the mod or want me to replace some of the UI, please let me know

Title: Battle Panel Party Panel
Description:
This simple mod replaces the overworld party panel in Tartarus with the higher-quality battle panel versions. I made this because the originals were discolored and lower-quality, and I tried resizing while keeping most of the battle panel quality intact. Hopefully you enjoy!

This works for both The Journey and The Answer!

P3P UI Compatible! If, for whatever reason, you feel like installing both of these mods, make sure you put this mod at a higher priorityÂ than P3P UI.
*If you want the original backdrop color in the battle portraits, delete the SND_BENC folder from the P3P UI mod

Title: (WIP) [OPEN BETA] New Moon Rebalance Patch v3.0
Description:
DO NOT SAVE OVER YOUR SAVE FILE IN THE EVENT OF GLITCHES

The Open Beta runs from 5/7/21 to (???). There will be an update for the beta halfway in, either on the 8th or the 9th, addressing early concerns/ bugs.

The file format is much less finalized and is likely not compatible with other mods, this is only temporary.
INSTRUCTIONS
â¢ Build the mod in Aemulus. I highly recommend using it in conjunction with the mod menu for testing purposes.
â¢ Use the cheat code provided to get Party Member skills at lvl 99. Make sure you use the correct one and not both at the same time
â¢ Do not overwrite your save file. Do not do not do not
â¢ Begin testing. If you would like to call the boss fights, open the mod menu and call fights 423, 425, 426, and 427 for the four altered fights (in order)

SUBMITTING BUGS/FEEDBACK
The first user to report a specific bug will be awarded points. For fairness, please comment bugs instead of DMing them to me. If you have concerns/ feedback you aren't comfortable maki ...

Title: (WIP) Controller Button UI Replacements
Description:
This mod replaces the Controller Button UI with your choice of either a Xbox or Switch UI (once Xbox is finished).

The way the game handles the UI not just a single file with the buttons in them, there is a file for EACH place a button appears, so one for each of the shops, one for the save menu, etc. So as you can probably imagine, this was actual CBT.

Title: P3 Movie Music FES
Description:
Replaces the game's music with songs from all four of the Persona 3 movies. Broadly speaking, they correspond to the same situations from the movies. (i.e. Persona Summoners plays while fighting Tartarus minibosses, since it played while fighting a Tartarus miniboss in the first movie)

This also has some artistic license just for fun, like Tartarus and The Abyss of Time's themes being replaced with music from the movies based on whoever will be important during that block. Leftover tracks use the high quality versions from my conversion/expansion of this game's HQ music mod for Portable on here, to clear up any confusion. It also "adds" a song via messing with an ambient sound loops (the night trip to Gekkoukan has music now)

Title: Item Selector - Cheat Generator
Description:
System requirements

- Microsoft Excel 2007 or above. (.xlsx file)

or

- LibreOffice (Free)

LibreOffice is compatible with Microsoft Excel more than Apache OpenOffice which I recommended before. But there is one caveat. You have to set an option before using it for Cheat Generators.

1. Run LibreOffice.

2. Click(Run) Calc Spreadsheet.

3. Set the following option.

Tools -> Options

- LibreOffice Calc -> Formula

-- Recalculation on file load -> Excel 2007 and newer: Always recalculate

4. Click the OK button.

5. Exit the Calc.

Screen images: Item

Â Â Â 

Â Â Â 

Â Â Â 

How to use: Item

1. Open "Item Selector for Persona 3 FES.xlsx"

2. Change to Item sheet.

3. Enter Qty(Cyan).

4. Select and copy the Cheat (pnach) cells that you want.

Â Â Â 

Â Â Â 

5. Save them as the pnach file on Cheats folder. For details, see the chapter "2. Check the pnach file name and the folder name." of Cheat Problem Guide.

6. I recommend to use PCSX2OTC - One time cheat tool for PCSX2 instead of the pnach meth ...

Title: Cut-In Duplicator
Description:
So, you want to edit game's cut-ins. And you have no idea where they are.
Well, they are in BTL.CVM/BATTLE/CUTIN, stored in packed containers.
This doesn't seem so bad right? But we can't forget this is an Atlus game, there are 191 packed containers that have duplicated cut-ins in them. Replacing each one individually would be too painful.

So I decided to make a batch script that just automatically copies your edited cut-ins to the right directories
Simply edit the cut-ins in @cutins folder, then (if you didn't edit all characters) remove the unneeded stuff from .bat and simply run it. It will automatically make right folders for all cut-ins that you can use in an Aemulus mod.

Note: Merging every time with Aemulus takes too much time, so I recommend releasing modded cut-ins already packed.

Title: Party Skill Editor
Description:
What
The Persona 3 Party Skill Editor is a program with two purposes:

-It can restore any changes made to party member skills by mods or cheats
-It can prepare a save file for use with the New Moon balance patch, by giving party members the skills they should have

How does it work
The program works like this:

â¢ Asks for the game played (Journey or Answer)
â¢ Asks for unmodded P3 or New Moon
â¢ Asks for the date
Asks for the level of each party member

The program will then spit out a cheat code document, containing the skills that each party member should have at the level provided in the game provided for the type provided.

It may sound complicated but it is really straight-forward on your end.

Instructions
Instructions:
-Drag Party_Skill_Editor.py into a command prompt window
-Follow the instructions given by the program
-Drag the created cheat code folder into your cheat code loader of choice (for PCSX2 it's the cheats folder)
â¢ Open the game
â¢ Verify that your party members have ...

Title: How to edit TMX files
Description:
Things to download/Things that are needed
1. Amicitia: Amicitia - post amicitia
2. PersonaEditor: Releases Â· Meloman19/PersonaEditor Â· GitHub
3. CpkTmxTool: Amicitia - post cpk-tmx-tool
4. An image editing software (could be anything, just as long as it works well for you)
5. Aemulus Package Manager: Aemulus Package Manager [Persona 4 Golden (PC)] [Modding Tools] (gamebanana.com)
6. TGE's Debug Log Pnach: Amicitia - post p3fes-debuglog
7. Extracted "data.cvm" and "btl.cvm" files: data.cvm btl.cvm
8. (Optional) Notepad++: Downloads | Notepad++ (notepad-plus-plus.org)

Things to know beforehand
Some of the .tmx files are in .pak, .bin or .cpk files
Amicitia and PersonaEditor can edit .pak and .bin files perfectly, but .cpk files need Tekka's CpkTmxTool to extract the imbedded .bins

Getting Started

Installing TGE's pnach
Copy the pnach onto your clipboard
Either import it into your current .pnach file or make a new one
Make sure that the "Show Console" option is on under "Misc"

If you' ...

Title: How to change the music in P3Fes
Description:
Things to download:
1. Aemulus Package Manager: Aemulus Package Manager [Persona 4 Golden (PC)] [Modding Tools] (gamebanana.com)
2. A HostFS ready game: Modding Using HostFS on PCSX2 (P3/P4/SMT3) (shrinefox.com) *link to ShrineFox's tutorial*
3. Audacity: Download | Audacity Â® (audacityteam.org)
4. The P3Fes BGM List: BGM.CVM - Amicitia Wiki (miraheze.org)
5. AtomENCD: Amicitia -> ATOMEncd (jcink.net) *download everything uploaded by ShrineFox in the site*
6. The track you want to add: *make sure it's in .wav form*

*FYI, Most songs won't loop in the beginning of the song. Make sure you know where the song properly loops for best results*

Amplifying the track before choosing sample points
In Audacity, press Ctrl+A and the "Effect" tab.
Click the "Amplify" option and amplify it by 3db.
Click "Allow clipping" and you're set to move onto the next steps.

Finding the song name and loop points
Find the track number for the song you want to replace in the P3Fes BGM List, for example "23.ADX ...

Title: Using Skill Progression mods with old saves
Description:
This tutorial is a bit complex to explain, but it is incredibly simple in practice.

What is this tutorial for?
This tutorial is for mods such asÂ Faithful Party RebalanceÂ andÂ The Answer Skill progression mod. It is intended solely for fixing the skill progression of party members, not Personas, albeit you can use this tutorial to have somewhat of the same effect.

The above two mods, along with future mods that change party skills/ levels, are flawed because they only work properly with party members that have not passed the level at which the new skills are learned. For example, if a mod makes Junpei learn Power Charge at level 60, and he is level 61 on your save file, then it is impossible for him to learn Power Charge without this tutorial.

These changes can add up if pre-existing moves have different levels. Take Junpei for instance:

â¢ Cleave (innate) is replaced by Kill Rush (level 25) is replaced by Gigantic Fist (level 55)
If Junpei does not learn Kill Rush at level 25, he wil ...

Title: How to setup mods for P3P
Description:
Introduction
Persona 3 Portable modding is very simple and easy to do. The modding community is pretty small as of now, and most mods are in the Amicitia website. This tutorial will explain how to set up mods for P3P for people who don't have a clue on where to start.

Requirements

A Persona 3 Portable ISO (a link will not be provided in this tutorial)

PPSSPP

Mod Compendium

7zip or WinRAR

A place to download mods. GameBanana/Amicitia

Step 1: Unpacking the ISO

With either 7zip or WinRAR, extract the ISO by either double clicking it or right clicking the iso and clicking the "Extract to" option.

Wait for everything to be done extracting, and make sure that the directory looks like this "P3P_filename/PSP_GAME"

Step 2: Moving the extracted ISO into PPSSPP

Move the extracted Persona 3 Portable ISO into PPSSPP. This is so you won't have to repack the ISO after making a new umd0.cpk file .

The extracted P3P file should go in the "PPSSPP/memstick/PSP/GAME" directory

It should sho ...

Title: Less flat Characters

After a really long time and a lot of work, I am publishing this as a proper mod.
My intent when doing mods is to improve the game's aspect and give it a look that can age better than the original to better preserve the experience of the game.
To do so I've worked on a couple of model mods and decided that the most impactful thing I could do was to modify the hairs of the characters because they are quite defining for a character in this art style, after all the body is not that detailed and doesn't get that much attention.

Title: Improved Naoto Social Link
Description:
The main purpose of this mod is to give Naoto Social Link a better feel and flow for her romance Route. The changes that have been made, while small, are extremely impactful on giving more control to Naoto in her actions instead of being essentially being manipulated into them by the main protagonist.Â 

Every change for this mod is OPTIONAL, and different versions are available to suit peoples preferences.

Romance Starting DialogueÂ 
While the starting Romance dialogue "I like that you're a girl." Is fine, doesn't really match Yu's character, and is just a bit of a weird thing to say in the moment.Â 

The change done here reinforces the overall message of gender being irrelevant to Naoto's skill as a detective and fits the scene better. In order to do this I basically just flipped the second option to the first option so it's the new romance flag. I adjusted her responses to this afterward to make it more directed at Yu. The original being "Now that I have friends who say this to me" re ...

Title: Unmissable Books
Description:
This quality of life mod gives you a second chance (at a cost) to acquire the following missable books by making them purchasable from the previously unused Okina Station Bookstore:

â¢ Witch Detective
â¢ Poly-land
â¢ The O-Cha Way
â¢ The Divine Way

This new Okina Station Bookstore restocks on the same days as the Yomenaido Bookstore in Shopping District, South. Each book costs 5000 yen and becomes available on the next available restock date after the corresponding event.

Whenever you interact with the store it will remind you of these dates, but you can also use "Useful Calendar" to easily track them.

With regards to time management, it's still more efficient to acquire these books from their events so you have a few more days to read them, but at least now if you miss any of those events you don't have to start a whole new game to get the "Compulsive Reader" achievement or the Reader King accessory.

Compatibility
The "regular version" of this mod is incompatible with Hyperspeed Read ...

For now, this just takes you back home to read, playing the regular event. However, once events can be edited properly (assuming that happens) I plan to make a separate event so you can actually see yourself reading in the library.

Title: Crane Game Rebalanced
Description:
This mod rebalances the crane game to make it less tedious.Â 

Normally, you would pay 100 yen for one try. Days that end with 0, 2 and 6 (10th, 12th, 6th etc.) allow the protagonist to play twice per attempt. The 30th of each month is a "miracle day" that boosts your chances of getting a prize.

With this mod however, every day behaves like a miracle day with the increased win rate and you get two tries per attempt. In practical terms, it should take far fewer attempts to get the grand prizes when they're available than normal. Luck is still a factor.

To balance the increased odds, the price of play has also been upped from 100 to 500 per attempt (two tries).

Title: Animated Logo for Steam

â¢ Right-click the banner at the top and select Manage > Set Custom Logo.
â¢ Select the PNG in this download and enjoy your new animated logo!

Title: Persona 420 Golden (PC)
Description:
Development History
When P4G was ported to PC, I knew that modding would run rampant. One of my favorite videos of all time is "Persona 420 Mod - Download in Description", and I remember seeing it get ported to the Vita. I had the feeling that someone would port it to PC, but I never imagined it would be me. There were two main issues with porting this in the first place. The first is that the pac files didn't actually change Yosuke at all, meaning I had to manually copy every single texture into literal hundreds of folders. In order to do that in the first place, I had to extract the TM2 files from all of the AMDs (which was quite a few), convert them to PNG, convert those PNGs to DDS, then copy the DDS' into the different folders. The second issue that arose is the fact that they completely overhauled the sound system in the PC port, opting to use XWB files in the SND directory, meaning I had to manually match up each and every individual file. Unfortunately, there were a couple issu ...

The mod is missing Satanael, what's up with that?
Well, Satanael doesn't import properly into the game, so I've decided to cut him off until I can figure out a way to get him imported properly

You said the mod would have UI, where is it?
The UI isn't finished, so it'll be added on a future update, mostly because I want to have a complete UI, and All Out Attacks UI changes are tricky to do.

Where are Arsene and Raoul's curse skills?
I'll be honest, I don't know how to properly add skills yet, so like the UI, this is going to be added on an update.

Title: Dio Over Yu's Winter Yasogami High Outfit
Description:
Installation Instructions:
What you need:

â¢ Windows 7/8.1/10
â¢ The latest release of the Persona Mod Compendium (optional, but highly recommended)
â¢ A copy of Persona 4 Golden for PC set up for Modding
7zip
For installation with the Mod Compendium, place the "Dio Yu" folder from "Compendium-ready.7z" inside of Your "/Mod Compendium/Mods/Persona4Golden/PC/" directory. Open the Mod Compendium and choose Persona 4 Golden as the game. Then, press the "Settings" button. Next, check the box that says "PC mode." Choose the directory that you want your built mods to be built into (usually the "mods" folder in the game directory is what I choose so I don't have to move or copy any files around.) Ignore the other options, as those are for PS Vita. Then, press "build" and it will automatically install the mod for you if you've done everything correctly.

For generic installation, just drop all of the folders inside of "Generic.7z" into your game's "mods" directory. Merge if it says to merge anyt ...

As of 2019, his films have grossed US$7.2 billion worldwide, and he has placed eight times in annual rankings of the highest-paid actors in the world. On his off time, however, Jackson Enjoys to stream himself playing games on the popular streaming site, Twitch. With the power of modding you too can be Jackson Tucker, doing all of the things he does on a daily basis, like solving murders. In this mod, I replaced 47 amd files by now adding 3 new models and tweaking 10 more for a total ofÂ  16 weapons. I've modified so far all Naoto's weapons I intended to, a sword, and some of Kanji's shields. Most of them are pretty simple changes, all things that are suggested by the texture but not fully modeled.
I don't think I'll modify neither Yukiko nor Chie's weapons.
I really need your feedback on this mod, it would mean a lot to have opinions on whether or not i should remake some models or scrap them.

Title: No Glasses Mod
Description:
Introduction:

Persona 4 Golden has great character designs, and surprisingly they all look pretty good in glasses too! But aren't you tired of always seeing them in glasses whenever you're fighting shadows in dungeons? Well why don't we spice things up a bit this time! Introducing the No Glasses Mod!

Overview:

This mod is pretty simple, all it does is make the glasses invisible whenever you're in a dungeon. This means that your characters will still be wearing the glasses in cutscenes and other events. This way it still kind of makes sense to the story. I know what you're thinking though, "how will the Investigation Team be able to see through the fog inside the TV!?!" The answer is simple, with advanced technology, they are now able to wear contact lenses :D!

My Wifey~!!! <3<3

Title: Save Everyday
Description:
A mod that makes the save prompt to show up at the beginning of every day (just before early morning starts).Â 
(Requested by Emphabet on discord)

Compatibility (Please Read!)
This mod has now been added to Custom Sub MenuÂ so if you are already using that you can just enable it in its menu. Also, if you are using Remove Lunchtime InvitationsÂ orÂ Remove Hot Springs & Camping Trip EventsÂ please use Custom Sub Menu (which contains all of the mods as options) as those mods are incompatible with this.

A Known Issue
When saving with this the location you are in will not be labeled correctly in the save. This has no effect on gameplay, it is just a visual glitch. I may be able to fix it but for now, you'll have to live with it.

Title: Colorful Skills
Description:
This mod colors the icons for Persona Skills in battle.

The colors for each element match Persona 5 with the exception of Mudo, which is purple to differentiate it more clearly from Agi.

Due to the way the game renders these textures, there are some unsolvable issues:

â¢ Non-elemental Skills in Persona 4 all use the same icon, so there is no unique color to differentiate healing, buffs/debuffs, status effects, etc.
Skill icons in a Persona's status screen are unchanged as their colors would be incorrect (see next point).
â¢ Skill icons in the Skills menu outside of battle will have incorrect colors when they are not highlighted (see the last screenshot above for an example). For this reason, the icon for passive skills has been left unchanged.

Title: Yosuke Romance

It's finally here!Â 

After a long time of being lazy, procrastinating, testing params, and fixing spelling errors, the mod is here.Â 

This mod adds a romance for Yosuke, and comes in multiple versions to accommodate as many people as possible. The mod edits rank 6-10, and the camping scene to change it for people who had a problem with the way Yosuke acted towards Kanji. All these changes are optional.Â 

The current 4 versions are; FULL, Rank 10 Only, Only S-Link, Rank 10 and Camping Scene.

The mod is Aemulus compatible, so if you use that, you can just drop it in the packages folder. If you don't use Aemulus, you can just place the data00004 folder in your mods folder like usual.Â 

There will also be post-release support to add some things I cut, and further support the mod.

Important Info

To clear up some confusion, it's impossible to include everyone's headcanons. I made this mod with the general idea most people have for how a Yosuke Romance would have played out. That said, how ...

Title: P4G Custom Sub Menu
Description:
Introduction
This community-developed mod combines a number of script edits from a variety of modders into one powerful, configurable package.

Everything can be customised to your liking from the in-game sub menu at any time.

Preview
Warning: video features some minor spoilers.

Features
Quality of Life - Overworld

â¢ "Quick Travel Plus" by Tekka and ShrineFox

When enabled, this mod expands the fast travel menus in both the sub menu and overworld map with additional locations. This means less time wasted when getting from A to B!

Note: this mod is similar to an older one with fewer options called, "Better Map Navigation". To avoid conflicts, please remove that mod before enabling "Quick Travel Plus" if you have it installed.

â¢ "Find a Friend" by AnimatedSwine37

When enabled, this mod adds a new "Spend time with..." entry to the sub menu if one of your Social Links is available that day. From here you can select their name to fast travel travel directly to them.

The mod has two ...

Title: P4G Community Enhancement Pack
Description:
P4G Community Enhancement Pack (P4G CEP) is an all-in-one collection of tools and mods for the 2020 PC release of Persona 4 Golden.

It includes over 40 enhancement mods that improve on the base game in a variety of ways. Whether it's improved textures, faster fast travel, or just making Dojima's talksprite blink, these mods make for a better first or five hundredth playthrough of P4G.

P4G CEP includes the Aemulus Package Manager program to make customization easy. All of the mods in P4G CEP can be individually enabled or disabled with Aemulus, and it's easy for users to add additional mods to their loadout without having to manually merge files.

P4G CEP is fully compatible with unmodded P4G save data and does not affect story progression or Steam achievement unlocks. You do not need to start a new game before using P4G CEP.

For update notifications and additional support,Â join the Discord server!

Installation
Complete step-by-step instructions are hosted on GitHubÂ and always up-to ...

Title: (DEPRECATED) Cutscene Aspect Ratio Fix
Description:
Features
â¢ Re-Encoded cutscene files with an aspect ratio fix, which includes
small black bars on either side of the screen. This is due to the
original PS Vita cutscenes being at a resolution of: 960x544 which
scaled by 2, gets you 1920x1088. In the original cutscenes the picture
is stretched to fit 1920x1080
â¢
Improved visual quality and aspect ratio fix mentioned above for the
low quality cutscenes. Re-encoded directly from the PS Vita files
â¢
Japanese and English Dub

If you would like to see a comparison comparing the low quality cutscenes: click here

Installation Instructions

â¢ The mod REQUIRES Aemulus Package Manager and p4gpc.modloader (both v1.4.0 MINIMUM), please install those first and set them up. Make sure that 'Use CPK Structure' is turned ON in Aemulus
â¢ Copy the folder called 'Cutscene Aspect Ratio Fix 1.1' and put it in your Aemulus package folder. Make sure to disable all older versions (if any)

FAQ

â¢ "I'm having an issue with X, can you help me please?"
If you're having issues with the movie stuttering, not playing or causing any other type of issue, please check the "Recommended Configuration" section and the comments on my other cutscene mod here: https://gamebanana.com/gamefiles/12229

This file has been encoded similarly to those, so it's very likely that a solution to your issue can be found there. If your problem persists after trying all of the suggest actions there, feel free to comment below and I will try my best to help you.

Check out Pixelguin's "P4G PC Fixes + Quality-of-Life Mod Directory" thread on the Steam Community forum.

Title: (OUTDATED) Original Persona 4 Intro
Description:
This mod has become outdated. A version of this mod that simply tells the game to play this video exists now, significantly reducing the file size.
You can download it here: https://gamebanana.com/gamefiles/14676

This is a mod for Persona 4 Golden that replaces Golden's current intro with the intro from the PS2 game.

How to Install:
IF YOU HAVE AEMULUS:
This mod is compatible with Aemulus.
Put the "PS2 Intro" folder in \Packages. Open Aemulus and enable the mod, refresh if it isn't showing up. After that build the mod, open the game through Reloaded, and now it should work.

If you don't use Aemulus:
Inside the "PS2 Intro" folder are folders called "movie00000" and "movie00002".
Place these two folders in \mods
Open the game through Reloaded and now it should work.

Common Issues/Troubleshooting:
If the game crashes upon starting up, you aren't running on version 1.1.
If the video plays but the audio is muted, you're running the wrong version of the game.
If the video is stuttering ...

Title: P5 Strikers Font
Description:
Persona 4 Golden has a wider font than the PS2 version of Persona 4, presumably to make the text easier to read on the small PS Vita screen. However, it's much too large for a PC monitor or even a television screen.

This mod replaces P4G's font with Linux Biolinum Bold, the font from Persona 5 Strikers. Each character was individually typed and spaced using Photoshop and PersonaEditor, which also fixes some overlapping glyph issues from the original font. Some characters have also been adjusted to fit texture height limitations.

Title: Produce Store
Description:
Restores the cut content, Produce Store.Â  Now you can buy as much seedlings and plants during winter as you want.Â Â 

Produce store starts being available 5/22 from the Lady in front of Dojima's Residence and in Junes.Â  Seedlings come in stock the same date as they originally do.

Prices for seedlings stay the same since you still have to wait to grow them.Â  However, in an attempt to keep the game balanced,Â  I increased the prices of the plants themselves since there's no limit to how much you can buy them.

There's also a No Seedlings version for those who really care about balance.Â  The Farmer lady's functionality returns to normal during winter for this version instead of opening up the Produce Store.

Title: Personas & Skills Expansion Pack
Description:
Introduction
This mod expands and modernises Persona 4 Golden's battle system with additional Personas and skills ported faithfully from Persona 3 FES/Portable and Persona 5 Royal, respectively.

It's the culmination of months of work and the combined realisation of the following projects:

â¢ P3 Persona Restoration Project

â¢ P5R Moveset Backport Project

This is also the first P4G mod to use TGE's preappfile to add new models to the game, not just replace or tweak existing files.

If you enjoy my contributions for P4G, check out my Ko-fi page. You can also let me know by clicking the "Like" and "Thank" buttons on this page. :)

Features
Personas

â¢ All 21 Personas from P3 FES/P that were cut from P4G have been restored. No existing Personas have been replaced, only additions have been made.

â¢ Every new Persona contributes to the Persona Compendium completion percentage and has its own slot when registered.

â¢ Every new Persona is available in Shuffle Time (except those which can only ...
