Title: Extended School Hints
Description:
What is this?

This is a comprehensive text patch for the PC Version of Persona
4 Golden which is aimed to allow new players to get the answers in
school questions right by deduction rather then needing to use an
external guide or the available cheat mods.

It is aimed to keep
the original spirit alive so I've tried to add lines where possible but
some original texts were modified to bridge logic holes.

This mod was a suggestion by the excellent mod creator rudiger__gb!
Make sure to check out his work. Thanks again for the intro into the
tools and even more for proofreading. :)Â  This mod wouldn't have happened without you!

More information and WIP on GitHub.

Use with Aemulus.
Likely incompatible with "Classroom Cheat Sheet"-Mod by Tekka

Feel free to feedback either here or create a pull request on gh. :)Â  Any suggestions are welcome.

Title: Persona 4 Golden XP Share
Description:
Warning: If you have 'banked' level-ups from the mod and do an event that adds a move to one of the party members, the member will level up but not learn any of the moves they should have. For now, I'd recommend trying to use all banked level-ups before you leave the TV, however, I know this isn't always easy/possible. This will only be fixed once I work out how to get inactive party members to level up which may not be for a long time (eventually hopefully).

A Reloaded II mod that adds XP sharing to Persona 4 Golden so inactive party members don't get left behind.

Installation
As this is a Reloaded II mod it can be installed directly from Reloaded under the download mods section. Alternitavley you can manually install it by extracting the zip into Reloaded's mods folder. Once installed, go to the p4g section and enable it. This mod does not rely on p4g modloader (or any other mod), unlike the majority of mods so it can be used completely on its own if you so wish.

Things To Note
...

Title: Remove Lunchtime Invitations
Description:
A simple mod that removes lunchtime invitations to spend time with a social link after school as these are annoying and essentially redundant when using Find A Friend.

Installation
This can be installed usingÂ AemulusÂ by putting it into the packages folder and building your mods. It can also be installed manually by putting data00004 into your mods folder.

Compatibility
This mod has now been added toÂ Custom Sub MenuÂ so if you are already using that you can just enable it in its menu. Also, if you are using Save EverydayÂ orÂ Remove Hot Springs & Camping Trip EventsÂ please useÂ Custom Sub MenuÂ (which contains all of the mods as options) as those mods are incompatible with this.

Title: Remove Hot Springs & Camping Trip Events
Description:
A simple mod that completely disables the camping trip, removes the section of the hot springs event where "the guys get abused" and removes the cross-dressing and group date cafe portions of the culture festival made to fulfill this request.

If you want to remove only some of these events please use Custom Sub Menu as this mod is now built into it (under the name 'Remove Events') and allows you to remove each of the listed events individually. If you use the version on this page all of the listed events will be removed.

Compatibility
This mod has now been added to Custom Sub Menu so if you are already using that you can just enable it in its menu. Also, if you are using Save Everyday or Remove Lunchtime Invitations please use Custom Sub Menu (which contains all of the mods as options) as those mods are incompatible with this.

Installation
This can either be installed using Aemulus by putting the mod into its packages folder and building (recommended way to install) or you can insta ...

Title: 5th Dungeon - Key Prompt
Description:
Features
This is a small QOL tweak that adds a few extra lines to a one-time Rise prompt that appears when you first reach the 7th floor of the 5th dungeon, "Void Quest".Â 

On this floor is a miniboss that can easily be missed, but needs to be defeated before you can progress to the dungeon boss since they hold the final room key.

Having to backtrack is pretty tedious in P4G, so the idea behind this mod is to give attentive players a hint so they can avoid the need to do so.

New text starts after "Umm... I'm getting scared...":

[msg MIT_067_2 [Rise]]
[f 0 5 -258][f 2 1]It sounds like he's losing it...[n][f 1 1][e]
[f 0 5 -258][f 2 1]He might be insane...[n][f 1 1][e]
[f 0 5 -258][f 2 1]Umm... I'm getting kinda scared...[n][f 1 1][e]
[f 0 5 -258][f 2 1]...[n][f 1 1][e]
[f 0 5 -258][f 2 1]...?![n][f 1 1][e]
[f 0 5 -258][f 2 1]I'm sensing a powerful enemy on this floor.[n][f 1 1][e]
[f 0 5 -258][f 2 1]We should probably check it out before[n]moving on.[n][f 1 1][e]

If my work has made ...

Title: Dojima's Coffee
Description:
This mod backports the QoL mechanic in P5 that let's you remove your exhaustion after having a back massage from Kawakami.

Since there's no maids in P4, I instead chose to use Dojima's social link to utilize this feature.Â  It makes sense since he gives you a coffee mug and coffee wakes you up.

This feature will only be unlocked after obtaining the Coffee Mug key item after reaching the max social link level with Dojima.Â  Note that this means its available right away if you have it in New Game+.Â  Interact with the kitchen after returning from the TV World in order to use.Â  Special days that normally don't allow you to do stuff at night are prohibited from using coffee.

This mod is compatible with the custom square menu as well so feel free to use together.

Title: Default to Direct Commands
Description: This mod was made to prevent the minor annoyance of having to switch the tactics of a new party member to Direct Commands.Â  It does this by setting the tactic to Direct Commands when you enter the tv studio the day they're made available.Â  If you want to switch back to any other tactic, it also won't keep switching back to Direct Commands.Â  This mod modifies an entirely different file from all the script mods coming out so feel free to just use this along with any other script mod.

Title: Hyperspeed Reading+
Description:
This mod makes it so if you've read Hyperspeed Reading when reading a book with only one chapter left you'll be able to read another chapter of another book afterwards.Â 

Installation
It is recommended to use AemulusÂ to install the mod and there should be no conflicts with any other existing mods.Â 

Compatibility
Versions that are compatible with combinations of Tekka's Rename Teddie to Kuma and True Widescreen Textboxes are available. If you want to use one of these only download the version you want as well as the original mod from Tekka and make sure the Hyperspeed Reading + one is a higher priority.

Cool Trivia
Whilst making this mod I discovered leftover messages that suggest this was going to be a native feature in the game. Also, I took the line that shows when you read a second book directly from this.

I also found messages suggesting there was going to be a feature where you could read series' of books. What this would do differently though I don't know. Although, it's possi ...

Title: Reap-Balanced Encounters
Description:
This mod changes the behaviour of Reaper encounters.

In Persona 4 Golden, you can obtain special equipment for your party members by defeating the Reaper. The idea behind this mod was to rebalance the mechanic and make collecting this equipment less of a chore by removing the random element.

Normally, after 21 chests have been opened the player will begin to hear the sound of chains rattling. The 22nd chest to be opened will then MAYBE contain the Reaper instead of a normal encounter if you're lucky and it's a normal chest (not gold/locked).

With this mod, the 22nd normal chest you open will ALWAYS contain the Reaper. If you don't want to face the Reaper, you can simply dismiss the prompt and move to another floor. This will reset the chest counter back to zero. Returning to the entrance with or without dismissing the prompt will also reset the counter.

In the downloads are different versions that combine other mods.Â  Use that version instead of both of them combined.Â  Even more co ...

Title: QoL Dungeon Menu Options
Description:
Dungeon Fast Travel
This fast travel option will not appear in your square button menu until the last day to save/catch/defeat deadline for that dungeon has passed.Â 

In practical terms, this means that it won't be available until after you've beaten the main boss of a dungeon and the bonus boss becomes available.

It's a great convenience mod even for a first playthrough!

Organize Party

Be able to add/remove/switch out party members in the middle of the dungeon through the square button menu.Â  Switching out members needs to reload the floor to work.Â  However, the good thing is that the floors won't reset, so you can easily go back to where you left off.

Quick Goho-M
Use your Goho-M in dungeon from the square button menu instead of having to open up the pause menu and looking for it in your items.Â  If you try to use it with 0 left, you will receive some messages from the current navi.Â  Note that the option will be disabled after the deadline when you can fast travel so that you don' ...

Title: P4G Save Anywhere Mod
Description:
WARNING: THIS IS NOT
MEANT TO REPLACE THE NORMAL SAVE FUNCTION, SAVING IN ROOMS THAT AREN'T
MEANT TO BE SAVED IN MIGHT HAVE UNINTENDED CONSEQUENCES SUCH AS
SOFT-LOCKING A SAVE DUE TO A CAMERA BUG. I AM NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY
SAVES THAT ARE HARMED FROM THE USE OF THIS MOD. ALWAYS KEEP BACKUP
SAVES, USE AT YOUR OWN RISK.

A mod that lets you press the square button to open a save menu even outside of where you can normally save. Don't forget to make backup saves as certain areas break the load function. If you do find and area where this happens, please submit an error.

The .flow and .msg I used are included if you wanted to do any edits. To recompile, download AtlusScriptCompiler and overwrite the Library folder with this one. Then use the GUI to convert the .flow to .bf.

Title: Skip Velvet Room Game Over Screen
Description:
Skips Velvet Room scene after dying in a dungeon.Â  Great to use when you die many times such as in SCArkadia's Nightmare Mode mod.

Note: This modifies init_free.bin/field/script/field.bf which is the same file that ShrineFox's Mod Menu modifies, so whichever one takes higher priority will overwrite the other.

Title: Igor Contract
Description: A mod that brings the Igor Terms of Service from P5 to P4G.Â  This only occurs when you start a New Game.Â  Agreeing will continue making a new game as per usual while disagreeing will bring you straight back to the title screen.

Title: Useless Character Switch
Description:
This is a small script mod of scheduler_04.bf that prompts you at the New Game screen to select a male or female protagonist. It doesn't do anything except set flag 9999 to ON when you select female. This number was chosen at random as an example and I don't know if it's used for anything else or not.Â 

The .flow and .msg I used are included if you wanted to do any edits. To recompile, download AtlusScriptCompiler and overwrite the Library folder with this one. Then use the GUI to convert the .flow to .bf.

For an actual mod that utilizes this feature, you would probably need to make Reloaded II patches for the game that check the flag whenever it loads assets related to the player (models, voices, UI graphics...) and redirect them to the replacement.

Title: Genshin Impact Font
Description: Changes the main in game font to a font similar to the one found in Genshin Impact.Â  To be used with Aemulus Package Manager.

Title: Trans Naoto P4G PC
Description:
This mod has been up on tumblr for awhile, but I'm reposting it here in case you want to use it with other mods.

By now I suspect we all know the drill: this mod changes dialogue,
system messages, etc. to refer to Naoto with either he/him or they/them
pronouns, as well as rewriting their social link and some miscellaneous
scenes to better reflect that they arenât a girl. It also removes both
pageants from the game entirely - the cross-dressing outfits are instead
awarded the first time the player visits the costume shop after
November 9th.

Title: Keep Inventory in Hollow Forest
Description:
WARNING: Backup your save data before using this mod in case anything goes wrong!

Prevents the game from removing your inventory and equips when entering the Hollow Forest dungeon, so you can still use all your regular costumes, items, armor etc.
The flowscript I created for this mod is included if you want to take a look at how it was made!

Also includes an alternate version that gives you all the costumes (even if you haven't unlocked them previously), but otherwise uses the usual Hollow Forest inventory-- so no armor, weapons, consumables etc. from other places.

Should work with either the Mod Compendium or Aemulus Package Manager. Probably works for Vita too.

Title: BGM Enhanced: Aemulus
Description:
Description
BGM Enhanced: Aemulus allows for extending and customizing P4G's use of battle BGM.

Features

â¢ Expanded music slots! Only limited by the amount of entries in BGM.xwb (~1110). Music Manager includes support for ~130 new song slots (replaces unused Japanese interviews).

â¢ Battle music is now controlled by ENCOUNT.TBL. Each encounter's "MusicId" controls what song plays in that battle.
â¢ An encounter's "MusicId" now plays exactly that wave index; no second table nonsense!
â¢ Customizable randomized BGM!
â¢ No more Cheat Engine!

Requirements

Aemulus by Nerd Tekka: https://gamebanana.com/tools/6878
Inaba EXE Patcher by Weeb Tekka: https://gamebanana.com/tools/6872

Usage
â¢ Download then enable the Base Package in Aemulus.

â¢ Enable a BGME Config Package. You can either make one with P4G Encount Music Editor or download one.

â¢ Build in Aemulus and finished.

Making a Custom Preset
Use Encount Music Editor.

Recommended Song Packs with Support

Title: Useful Calendar
Description:
Introduction
This mod attempts to turn the calendar from something you might look at once in an entire play-through, to something actually useful...

There are two versions of this mod to choose from:

a spoiler-free version for players on their first play-through.

â¢ a complete version for players who have beaten the game before.

I recommend using either version with ShrineFox's "MobileCalendar" mod to make the calendar even more useful!

If my work has made your P4G experience more enjoyable, please consider showingÂ your appreciation atÂ my Ko-fi page.

Features
The spoiler-free version contains the following helpful entries:

â¢ "Bookstore restocked" - when new books are available to purchase from the store.
â¢ "Croco Fur restocked" - when new costumes are available to purchase from Croco Fur (Okina).
â¢ "Bulletin Board updated" - when new jobs are available from the town bulletin board.
â¢ "Crane Game restocked" - when a new prize is available from the crane game (Okina).
â¢ "New S. Lin ...

Title: Dungeon Text Fixes
Description:
This mod corrects some minor annoyances I had with notification text in dungeons. If you useÂ "P4G Custom Square Menu"Â or the CEP's "QOL Scripts Pack" this mod is already bundled in so there's no need to download it from here.

â¢ Inconsistent references to treasure chests as treasure "boxes"

In dungeons only, party members and text prompts will sometimes refer to treasure chests as "treasure boxes". This appears to be the only place in the game they do this. Everywhere else they'll be referred to as treasure "chests" consistently.

I've removed all of these "box" references so they're now only ever called "chests" here like they are in the rest of the game.

â¢ Notifications that suggest discoveries were made by party members independently

Party members will often notify you of new discoveries when you open doors in dungeons. The text will usually be along the lines of, "I found the stairs!" or "I found a shadow!". I always found this odd, because THEY as individuals didn't find anythi ...

Title: Asshole Igor - Gameover screen that mocks you
Description:
Compatible with Aemulus. Igor is incredibly disappointed in you, he didn't even bother to show up.

If you want to support me and my more serious mods (perhaps some of the shittier ones too) then uh subscribe to my YouTube thx. Every hour you aren't subscribed is an hour you aren't subscribed every hour one time an hour.

Title: Clean Title Bar
Description:
This mod changes the P4G window's title bar from "Persona4 GOLDEN [REV: XXXX]" to "Persona 4 Golden."

There is also an alternate version that changes the title bar to "Persona 4 The Golden" for use with Tekka's The Golden Fix mod.

Title: 100% Unlocked TV Listings
Description:
Are you a Persona 4 superfan who wants to get the Miracle Quiz achievement early?
Did the Steam cloud mess up your unlock data, leaving you in need of a quick fix?
Do you just want to peek ahead at all the cutscenes?
You can do all that with this mod!

This mod contains replacement system.bin + system.binslot files, which control which parts of the TV Guide are unlocked. As I've taken these from a completed save file, they should unlock everything in the TV Listings without touching your save data. In fact, when testing, I was able to use this mod without any save data at all!

Obviously, this mod will give you access to spoilers for the entire game. Some of the TV Guide programs (cutscenes, music) open to random media, so seeing spoilers is pretty much unavoidable if you install this mod.

Please note that this mod will not allow you to start a New Game+ file or anything like that. It only affects the TV Guide unlocks.

Instructions
â¢ Find your Steam user ID. The easiest way is to ...

Title: Slim Font
Description:
Persona 4 Golden has a wider font than the PS2 version of Persona 4, presumably to make the text easier to read on the small PS Vita screen. However, it's much too large for a PC monitor or even a television screen.

This mod replaces P4G's font with the slimmer Skip Std-B font, slightly edited to fit texture height limits. Each character was individually typed and spaced using Photoshop and PersonaEditor, which also fixes some overlapping glyph issues from the original font.

Title: Find a Friend
Description:
Important Information
This mod adds a new option to the fast travel menu allowing you to see all available social links and travel to them in a single click.
(If you like this mod then you may like my other quality of life mods, Remove Lunchtime Invitations,Â Stop Wasting Time On Social Links At NightÂ and Hyperspeed Reading +)

Installation
AemulusÂ is now required to use this mod. Simply place the files into your packages folder and build your loadout.

Things to take note of
Note: Social links that you can spend time with at night but not level up will show in the menu even if they can level up (as identified by the "+" after their rank), this is intentional as to alleviate confusion as to why they aren't showing in the menu. Please know that you will essentially waste your time if you spend time with them while they're in this state (that's why Stop Wasting Time On Social Links At Night exists after all)

Another note: I now believe this mod to be in a state of near perfection (in reg ...

Title: Ultimate Persona Compendium Registration
Description:
This mod allows the ultimate Persona, Izanagi-no-Okami to be registered in the Compendium once fused.

When applied, your Compendium completion percentage will be adjusted to reflect the extra Persona. Basically this means that a previously 100% "complete" Compendium, will drop down to 99% until you register this new Persona.

No other Personas have been touched by this change. Nothing has been replaced or removed. I've simply adjusted the flag that tells the game whether this Persona can be registered so it behaves like the others in this regard.

NOTE: If you have any saves with this Persona already fused, you will need to remove it from your party and re-fuse it to make it registrable.

If my work has made your P4G experience more enjoyable, please consider showing your appreciation at my Ko-fi page.

Title: Light/Dark Neutral mod
Description:
Have a mod that adds damage-dealing light/dark skills, but then you found out that they don't work on enemies that block dark/light, such as bosses? Ever wanted to just cheese a boss with an insta-kill move? Well, this mod is for you!

The Light/Dark Neutral mod is a simple mod that makes most bosses neutral/resistant to Dark and Light skills. There are some exceptions like Shadow Rise and Kasumi-no-Okami. The reasons being the fact that one battle is scripted, and I didn't know if insta-killing a scripted boss would cause problems. and for the latter, it's because the boss' entire gimmick is reflecting every element.

This is my first real mod so bare with me if there are some bugs.

Title: No TV Static
Description: An updated version of ShrineFox's "No TV Static" mod for compatibility with the latest version of the game.

Title: Culprit Boss AI Fix
Description:
Due to some oversights in the culprit's AI involving randomly-generated numbers, the Culprit's AI is unable to activate certain moves in their Arsenal, such as Stagnant Air, Bufudyne, Agidyne, Mabufudyne, and Maragidyne.Â  Not only that, but these oversights also make them less likely to use certain moves such as Evil Smile and Atom Smasher.

This mod fixes those oversights, allowing him to function as he was intended to.

Title: HEE! HEE! HOO! MUSIC RENAMER
Description:
This is a Reloaded II mod that uses a 'HeeHeeHo.uwus' file generated by P4G Music Manager to rename all of the songs found in the music channel.

Tutorial:

- Extract the p4gpc.heeheeho folder from the download and place it in your Reloaded II 'Mods' folder. ('Release' is my Reloaded II folder)

- Enable 'HeeHeeHo Music Renamer' in your Reloaded II Launcher by making sure the icon next to it is a red plus like so.

- Take your generated 'HeeHeeHo.uwus' file from P4G Music Manager and place it in your 'mods/SND' folder in your Steam game directory.

- Now when you launch the game you should see the renamed songs in the Music Channel.

Limitations on song names:

The boxes only fit about 47 characters so if the song name goes over that, the program will just cut it off and place an ellipses at the cut off point.

The only special character's I've added support for are the following:

It is now updated to include all characters that the game supports.

Manual HeeHeeHo.uwus

Also provided ...

Title: Manga Font
Description:
Replaces the main in game font with font found in most mangas.Â  Included in the download is the individual 'manga.fnt' file to be used if you want to manually merge with other init.bin's.Â  Just use it to replace system/font/font0.fnt.

Been feeling like making fonts lately.Â  Let me know if you have any other ideas for fonts and I'll try to mod them in the game.Â  (Btw tried ps2 P4 font ripped straight from the game but it turned out looking too small so I gave up on it.)

Also if you just want the cool error message and dont like the whole overhaul you could leave only crash_uwu.patch in the mods/uwu folder.

Description:
I spent way too much time on this...
Replaces all what's in dialogue to nani's because it's funny.Â  Also did the subtitles in the cutscenes.Â  Probably won't be too persistent on finding missing what edge cases but you can let me know anyways.Â  I'm also down for any more suggestions to weebify the dialogue even more.

In order to utilize the patches folder provided, make sure to install my Inaba Exe Patcher.

Title: Classroom Answers
Description:
Inspired by my Social Link Cheat Sheet mod.Â  Know the answers to all the classroom questions without having to google them.Â  Just pick the one with the asterisk next to it.Â  This includes all midterms and finals as well.

It should be compatible with every other script mod on this site excluding my True Widescreen Textboxes mod.Â  I'm providing another version of this mod to go with that one.

Just drop the extracted folders into Aemulus Package Manager to easily build a mod loadout.

Title: Belle Delphine Calendar

Belle delphine's calendar in Yu's bedroom.
Hope you like it.

Title: Fixed Knowledge Bonus (Studying)
Description:
In Persona 4 Golden, you can study at home to increase your Knowledge stat. This
passes time.

It's possible to increase your Knowledge stat three times per study session:

â¢ one guaranteed point for studying
â¢ one additional point for studying if you've also read "Expert Study Methods"
one extra point you can receive randomly if "a number of dictionary entries pique your interest".

Like the "Great Blessing"s you can randomly draw at the shrine, this "dictionary entries..." bonus point can be great for helping to max-out your knowledge stat and access any social links that require a certain level of Knowledge before the end of the year.

However, actually getting this message to appear would typically involve reloading your save repeatedly until you got the desired result...

This mod removes the random element, so you're guaranteed to receive the "dictionary entries..." message and bonus point every time.

It DOES NOT affect the point you receive for having read "Expert Study Meth ...

Title: Mario over Yu Narukami Portrait
Description: This mod lets you relpace Yu Narukami's Status and Level Up Portrait with Mario drawn in the design of Persona. Credit to Hakureign on twitter for the portrait.

Title: Always Great Shrine Blessing
Description:
In Persona 4 Golden, you can visit the shrine and draw a fortune to become closer to a Social Link of your choice. This costs money and passes time.

Normally, there are three different levels of blessing that you have you a random chance of drawing: "Small", "Mild" and "Great". Each give a different number of social links points, with "Great" giving the most.

This mechanic is particularly useful for helping to max-out social links before the end of the year since you can also use it at night, but actually getting a "Great Blessing" would typically involve reloading your save repeatedly until you got the desired result...

I always found this to be an odd design choice and a bit frustrating for the player, since getting a "Great Blessing" isn't exactly a broken mechanic and you can't rank-up a social link from the shrine either.

This mod removes the random element, so you're guaranteed to receive a "Great Blessing" every time.

If my work has made your P4G experience more enjoyable, ...

Title: Social Link Cheat Sheet
Description:
Are you one of those people who look up guides to determine the best choices for your social links?Â  This mod aims to let you see those best choices without having to look away from the game.

This mod displays the results of the choices that matter for each social link.Â  It provides it in +x/y format where x is the points you get without a persona of a matching arcana and y is the points you get with a persona of a matching arcana.Â  If there's no "+x/y" next to the choice it means it gives you 0 points no matter what.Â  I also included "(Love)." "(Broken)," and "(Reverse)" on the choices that bring you to those specific routes.

All of these point results were based fromÂ https://sites.google.com/site/persona4goldenguide/social-links. Â (Edit: This site ended up being pretty unreliable after testing lol). However, the social link guide was not fully complete as some results without matching arcana were left as "?".Â  For those missing results, I took an educated guess but I haven't gone a ...

Title: Stop Wasting Time On Social Links At Night
Description:
This mod displays an extra message telling you that spending the night with a social link will be 'wasted' if it is already ready to rank up as in P4G points do not carry over between social link ranks. (works for all S.Links that can't be ranked up at night such as the main party)

Can be installed through Aemulus by putting the mod into your packages folder (recommended) or by dropping data00004 into your mods folder.

Compatibility
To make this compatible with Tekka's - Rename Teddie to Kuma mod you must download BOTH the Kuma Patch zip file AND the main zip file below. Then if installing with Aemulus enable all three mods, ensuring the patch file loads FIRST like so:

If you're installing by dropping files directly into your mods folder install both the Kuma mod and this mod first (does not matter if you overwrite or not at this point), then lastly drop the patch's files in, ensuring to OVERWRITE when you're asked to.

Other than Kuma this should be compatible with all mods excep ...

Title: Rename Teddie to Kuma
Description:
I created this mod because I prefer using the Japanese over English voices in game.Â  It's pretty jarring to keep reading "Teddie" but hearing "Kuma."Â  That being said, this mod would probably not go too well if you play with the English voices.

Every single instance of "Teddie" should be replaced with "Kuma" whether its Teddie himself talking or others talking about him.Â  This includes:
- Stat and S.Link menus
- Dungeon dialogue
- Rise's navi lines
- Overworld dialogue
- Clothes descriptions
- TV Listings descriptions
- Calendar recollections

The Japanese OP as seen in the thumbnail isn't included in this mod as it's included in my other mod.

I had to ctrl+f and hex edit a lot of files so I may have missed lines here and there (hopefully not).Â  If you use my mod it would be greatly appreciated if you could tell me if you encounter something not being replaced.Â  I haven't tested the entire game but the small portion I have tested does work.

I found some instances of "Teddie" within ...

Description: Haven't had enough of the "My Superhero Movie over LITERALLY every song" mod? Well you're in luck! Inspired by the passion the op had to replace every song in P4G, I took it upon myself to replace the intro with the music video!

Title: Persona 4 Golden PC Takaya port
Description: This is a mod that adds Takaya Sakaki to Persona 4 Golden PC. This is another costume swap that contains a full animation and model swap. This replaces the Gag Winter outfit for Narukami.

This mod allows you to choose where you want to go when you select the School, the Flood Plain or the Shopping District in the town map.

Please tell me if there are any bugs.

Title: Detailed Descriptions
Description:
Introduction

In Persona 4 Golden, there are a number of descriptions and "info" boxes that I feel either don't tell you anything useful, or present information in an unhelpfully abstract way. This mod aims to correct that.

I recommend pairing this mod with Pixelguin's "Slim Font" which fixes the issues with overlapping letters that's present in the normal font and makes text a lot more legible on modern displays.

If my work has made your P4G experience more enjoyable, please consider showing your appreciation at my Ko-fi page.

Features
Item Descriptions
Skill Cards
The skill card "info" you can display in your item
list is practically useless; the descriptions simply reiterate the name
of the skill and tell you little else.

This mod adds detailed descriptions to every skill card in the game, so you can know instantly what a skill does before you teach it to your Persona.

Skill card description BEFORE:

Skill card description AFTER:

Key Items
Keys for unlocking doors are obtain ...

Title: Pogsona 4 Golden
Description:
I should pay Yuri Lowenthal to say "poggers" and put it over every Yosuke line. Thanks to /u/crossroadsts for the POG logo.

Installation Instructions:
What you need:

â¢ Windows 7/8.1/10
The latest release of the Persona Mod Compendium (optional, but highly recommended)
â¢ A copy of Persona 4 Golden for PC set up for Modding
â¢ 7zip
For installation with the Mod Compendium, place the "Pogsona 4 Golden" folder from "Compendium-ready.7z" inside of Your "/Mod Compendium/Mods/Persona4Golden/PC/" directory. Open the Mod Compendium and choose Persona 4 Golden as the game. Then, press the "Settings" button. Next, check the box that says "PC mode." Choose the directory that you want your built mods to be built into (usually the "mods" folder in the game directory is what I choose so I don't have to move or copy any files around.) Ignore the other options, as those are for PS Vita. Then, press "build" and it will automatically install the mod for you if you've done everything correctly.

For gene ...

Title: Persona 4: The Bruh
Description:
Bruh
What you need:

â¢ Windows 7/8.1/10
â¢ The latest release of theÂ Persona Mod CompendiumÂ (optional, but highly recommended)

â¢ 7zip

For installation with the Mod Compendium, place the "Bruh" folder from "Compendium-ready.7z" inside of Your "/Mod Compendium/Mods/Persona4Golden/PC/" directory. Open the Mod Compendium and choose Persona 4 Golden as the game. Then, press the "Settings" button. Next, check the box that says "PC mode." Choose the directory that you want your built mods to be built into (usually the "mods" folder in the game directory is what I choose so I don't have to move or copy any files around.) Ignore the other options, as those are for PS Vita. Then, press "build" and it will automatically install the mod for you if you've done everything correctly.

For generic installation, just drop all of the folders inside of "Generic.7z" into your game's "mods" directory. Merge if it says to merge anything and replace any ...

Title: Persona 5 Overhaul
Description:
This mod tries to replace every single aspect of the game that I can in a Persona 5 style just cuz.

Changed features included in mod:
* Main font
* Command select
* Menu select
* Menu prompts
* Battle popup identifiers (Critical, Weak, etc.)
* PS4/Xbox buttons
* Skill/item/affinity icons (partial items)
* Calendar UI
* Arcana cards (UI and models)
* Loading animation
* Map icons and color
* Critical and union cutins
* Velvet Room UI
* Social Link UI
* ...and more soon to come

Here's what I edited in the bin files in my mod:
Font

Various Menus, Loading Animation, and Map UI

Title: Comic Sans Font
Description: Changes the main font to Comic Sans.

Title: Reaper in Every Chest
Description:
Instead of Shadows or items, chests will always contain The Reaper. Just made it for fun while I was disabling trap chests.

KNOWN ISSUE: Problem causing item drops from The Reaper to be incorrect. See comments section for details. Not currently working on a fix, but might do so eventually. I did encounter some issues recompiling the script, so this is the likely cause. It might not work in one of the dungeons also, not sure which.

You will probably have to put up with hearing that stupid chain noise constantly once you interact with a chest, but who cares, you aren't going to use this mod for very long.

Check the GitHub page for similar mods.

Title: Disable Trap Chests
Description:
Stops Shadows from coming out of chests. Replaces Shadow spawns with item spawns.

There is a known issue with my Reaper mod that may also exist in this mod. Haven't done extensive testing in general; I did encounter some issues compiling the script, so use at your own risk.

May not work in one of the dungeons -- the code refers to a "tomb" in several places and I haven't messed with the encounters there, since I didn't want to screw something up that I didn't understand. Might update this later.

Check the GitHub page for similar mods.

Title: Donkey Kong Country Intro
Description:
So uh, ever felt like watching the Donkey Kong Country intro instead of that pesky Shadow World or Pursuing My True Self?
If your answer is yes then I'm glad, if your answer's no then I'm sorry, and if you're sickened and curious then feel free to download my mod.

INTRUCTIONS
You're gonna need:Â 

â¢ Unp4cker

â¢ The mod fileÂ 

1. ExtractFirst, download Unp4cker and extract the .zip file contents anywhere on your PC.

2. Enable PowerShell ScriptsBy default, PowerShell disallows running any custom scripts to protect against malicious scripts. If you've never used PowerShell scripts before, you'll need to enable them in one of three ways:
â¢ Right-click on the included "Enable PowerShell Scripts (Run as Admin).bat" file and--you guessed it--choose "Run as adminstrator"

â¢ Right-click on the Windows Start menu button and choose "Windows PowerShell (Admin)". In the PowerShell window that appears, run the command:
Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope "CurrentUser" -ExecutionPolicy "Unrestricted"
â¢ Open ...

Description:

â¢ Angled inner corners are now straight so that none of the map elements go out of bounds
â¢ Checkerboard
pattern has been removed as it clashed with the clean aesthetic of the

Title: Blue Aeon Arcana
Description:
This mod replaces the gold Aeon arcana card seen in Marie's Social Link and Shuffle Time with a plain blue one.

I personally disliked the visually distinct Aeon card and always wanted it to look the same as the rest; luckily for me, the blue Aeon card was hidden in the game files the whole time!

Title: P4 Arena Ultimax Battle Portraits
Description:
This is a set of battle portraits inspired by "Persona 4 Arena Ultimax".
They've been heavily tweaked to better fit P4G and (as of v2.0) even feature manually drawn glasses thanks to the great work of @FluffnFlight.

I've been careful to ensure this mod behaves exactly as it should with status effect colouring, transparency etc. all working perfectly.

If my work has made your P4G experience more enjoyable, please consider showing your appreciation at my Ko-fi page.

Title: Controller UI Overhaul
Description:
This mod replaces the controller UI with all-new icons that are higher-quality, more legible, and colorful!

The default button prompts in P4G are very lazily done: the fonts are inconsistent or hard to read, the shapes of the dpad and triggers can be incorrect, and all of them lack color. This mod aims to change that with a completely custom controller UI.

Compatible with all controller types (Steam Controller users will need to configure their gamepad in Big Picture settings).

Note: If you are using a next-generation controller (Xbox Series or PS5) and the game is not responding to button presses, open the Steam Properties window for P4G and set Steam Input Per-Game Setting to Forced On.

List of Improvements

Universal

â¢ Bigger, more legible font used for all text
â¢ Classic white "Check!!" UI (P4G used a red accent, but this only makes sense on the Japanese Vita version where it represented the circle button)

Xbox One / Xbox Series

â¢ Colorful face buttons

New - PS5

â¢ Monochro ...

Description:
Replaces the poorly-upscaled dungeon portraits with HD artwork from Persona 4 The Animation.

The portraits came from the anime's Blu-ray box art and have been carefully tweaked to fit P4G's UI.

Submitted on behalf of creator Hellkrai.

Please download Controller UI Overhaul instead of this mod, as it contains everything this mod has (and more!). This mod will not be updated or supported.

If you're looking for colorful PS4 icons, kasaski has made a lovely mod for that here!

This is the first mod I've made for, well, anything, so please let me
know if I missed a texture or if there's something that can be improved.

Instructions:
â¢ Set up TGEnigma's mod loader.

â¢ Extract the folder and place the data00004 folder in (p4g-dir)\mods.

Mod Merging:

Tekka has made a great guide for this here!

If you have another mod that alters data0004\init-free.bin, you will need to merge the mods together. Atlus Pack Merger is the best program for this task; simply follow the directions on the GitHub readme.

The file in just_the_texture_file.zip contains just the TMX file a ...

Title: Config Clarity
Description:
This mod overhauls almost every setting name and explanation in the Config menu. Changes range from fixing Engrish text to explaining the performance impact of graphics settings.

Hopefully this mod helps demystify the Config menu for everyone. I mean come on, "2D Display?" Really?

Title: P4AU Follow Up Portraits
Description:
This mod switches out the old Follow Up portraits with art from P4AU. The old art didn't fit in well with the rest of the updated art that's in P4G
Huge thanks toÂ rudiger__gb | Members (gamebanana.com)Â for sending me instructions for this mod so I can finish it! He decided to make this mod, but he got too busy to finish it, and I happened to ask how to replace the old art on Discord. Your PC isn't a PS Vita, so your P4G UI shouldn't have giant touchscreen buttons.

This mod changes the UI buttons that were originally meant for the PS Vita touchscreen into simple icons, making them less intrusive.

The "TV Overlay" icon that appears when the TV Overlay is first opened has been completely removed as well.

Title: Corrected Battle Portraits
Description:
Introduction
This mod attempts to correct the party battle portraits' design inconsistencies:

Colours now more accurately match those of each portrait's bustup art (e.g. Naoto's and Kanji's hair).

â¢ Mistakes like Chie's missing sleeve stripe and Kanji's sideburn length have been fixed.

â¢ Vibrancy has been increased a little for every portrait so they don't look so washed-out.

If my work has made your P4G experience more enjoyable, please consider showingÂ your appreciation atÂ my Ko-fi page.

Title: Xbox To PS4 Buttons Prompts for P4G
Description:
A set of converts for switching all controller button prompts To Playstation button prompts. Useful for people using DS4Windows or the game forcing button prompts you dont like.
This mod requires Reloaded 2 and the P4G mod loader, you can find a guide on how to set that up here.

There are 2 folders provided in each download, one is colored and the other is the default grey buttons. Using the Colored Variants will also change the original PS4 buttons to their colored versions

Please note that if the switch controller prompts are wrong you may have "Use Nintendo Layout" disabled in steam controller settings. Enabling this will fix that issue.

How to Install:
1. Setup Reloaded 2 and p4g, following the tutroial linked above.
2. Extract the "data00004" folder from either the colored or default folder into the /mods/ folder in your P4G install location. If the mods folder isnt there, create one.
3. Launch the game through Reloaded 2

Title: The Golden Fix
Description:
This mod changes every occurrence of "Persona 4 Golden" to "Persona 4 The Golden."Â  This was mainly done because ATLUS did a poor job of reworking the title screen to removing "The."Â  They don't take out "The" from under Press any button and they leave a gap between the logo and the rainbow border.Â  Instead of fixing this by taking out "The," I wanted to bring back the original title.

While working on the title screen I also fixed the typo "Retum to Inaba" to "Return to Inaba."

For full immersion, I included the logo change in the TV Listings menu and the Japanese OP and credits to replace the English logo.Â  These video files were taken from the latest hotfix_2a branch and just renamed to replace the English version of the videos.

The replacement videos are redirected based on the hotfix_2a branch movie pac files.Â  I haven't tested it but it should work on the previous hotfixes and first release by placingÂ p4ct042_e.usm from movie00002 inside a new folder named movie00001.

This mod ...

How to Install:

2. Extract the files in the zip to /mods/ in your P4G install location. If the mods folder isnt there, create one.
3. Launch the game through Reloaded 2

Title: Teddie but His Portraits are Cursed
Description:
All of Teddie's portraits and flattened Teddie's portraits have been replaced with their respective 3D models. I did not replace human Teddie's portraits or Shadow Teddie's and do not plan on doing it.

How to Install:
Aemulus:
Put the "Teddie 'On The Mark' Teddison AKA 'The Beast in Heat' AKA Ted" folder in <Aemulus-dir>\Packages
Enable the mod in Aemulus, refresh if it isn't showing up.
Build the mod, open the game through Reloader, and now it should work.

Manual:
Inside the "Teddie 'On The Mark' Teddison AKA 'The Beast in Heat' AKA Ted" folder is a folder called "data00001".
Place the folder in <P4G-dir>\mods
Open the game through Reloader and now it should work.

Title: PQ2 Critical Cutins
Description: Replaces critical attack cutins as well as union cutins with PQ2's critical attack cutins.Â  Upscaled 4x using waifu2x since 3ds sprites are small.Â  Works well with mods such as kioskx's PQ2 Panels modÂ or Ainri's Q2 All Out Attack Panels mod.Â  My Persona 5 Font and UI Overhaul mod also works well in conjunction since PQ2's UI is styled like P5 (Note that you'd have to manually merge the btlpanel.bin from the panel mods with this mod if used together).Â Â I don't have screenshots of all cutins because it takes forever for these cutins to trigger in game lol.

Title: Chicken Dance Mod (Nightmare Mode)
Description:
The chicken dance mod had unexpectedly crossed over the nightmare mod, so this is a compatibility mod to allow your chicken dance needs to flourish while being absolutely pummeled in Nightmare mode

Since nightmare mod will be updated almost every few days, I will no longer be making submissions. But that doesn't mean Shaggy and Carl will be gone. Oh no no no.

All you need to do is extract the init/loading.arc file from this mod, and put it into the lastest init_free.bin file from the nightmare mod using amiticia by TGE.

This way Shaggy and Carl will keep on dancing till the end of days :D

Title: Bearable Fast Forward
Description: This mod removes the TV static overlay when dialogue-skipping fast forward is activated. It also replaces the sound effect that plays while fast forward is active with Blues in the Velvet Room from Persona 3. If you prefer to skip your cutscenes in deafening silence, there is an option for that too.

Title: YU-Gi-Oh Summoning Cards
Description:
Yu-Gi-Oh cards over the ones the Persona Users break! It also is replaced by cards that makes sense for the user, so if you're a yu-gi-oh fan you might enjoy that little touch.

To install it follow this tutorial! The filepath is already setup for you, so all you have to do is open up data0003.pac with pac editor, use the search bar in the yugioh folder and type "dds" then hit control a and drag all the files into the pac editor.exe then wait a moment.

You will get 5 or 6 errors telling you that there are some files not found in the pac, this is ok! Click ok and let it continue, that's not your fault, it's mine because I'm lazy and forgot to delete them.

Title: Summoning arcana cards

both, the arts of blazblue cross tag battle and the P4 anime, the characters had their respective arcana at the time of summoning their personas but in the game they only have empty cards

this mod changes that for all costumes

Primarily these are costume textures to make the main cast's clothes more accurate to their portraits, but I may thrown in some others occasionally as optional extras.

accurate to his appearance in cutscenes.

Title: Chie Timeskip Hair
Description:
Tired of Chie's bowlcut? Looking for a change for your next playthrough? Download the Chie timeskip hair mod!
This mod applies her hair from the P4G epilogue to every single portrait besides her ski trip outfit.
Her shadow world portraits are also lacking glasses.

To use this mod you have to have the P4G Mod loader set up already.

Once that's achieved, put the data folders into the "mods" folder game's directory and start up the game!

Thanks for downloading.

Title: Rise Timeskip Hair Bustups
Description: This mod replaces all of Rise's bustups with modified versions of her hair after her timeskip.Â  This mod doesn't replace any of her models to match the bustups though.Â  I haven't fully tested if all the replacement textures work so let me know if I'm missing any or if any are broken.Â  I hope you all enjoy my first mod and sorry if any of the bustups didn't turn out great since I'm not that experienced in photoshop.

Title: Persona & SMT Calendar Pack
Description:
Introduction
This mod replaces Yu's Persona 3 bedroom calendar with a high-quality custom variant. Rep your favourite Persona or Shin Megami Tensei game in style!

There are 20 variants in this pack to choose from.

Additionally, I've included my Photoshop project file (.psd) for anybody who would like to easily create their own calendar.

If you enjoy my work, please let me know with a Like or Thank me with the corresponding buttons. :)

Title: Best girl themed room

Title: Pursuing my True Self AOAs
Description:
Replaces all of the AOA portraits to edited ones with the artstyle of used in the original Persona 4 Intro.
All of the portraits are done, but they don't load in because they use Japanese file names, and NR2 Unpacker can't handle the names so it just spits out a weird filename.
If you want to help me find them out follow these steps.
1. Enable the console in ReloadedII and look for these during an AOA:

2. Copy the name (to notepad)
3. Go to
data00002\tex2\battle\cutin\boko\koma4\4koma_x_X_(s or w)4. Each character will have a number, and it will be the same number as the one used for each koma folder. Ex: 1 - Yu 4 - Yukiko
5. Rename the .dds inside.
6. Post the names you find below, I'll update the mod if someone helps.
Note:
- Each character has a different name for their Winter/Summer uniforms (There's one day where everyone changes their outfits, and I'm not at that point yet, I haven't named them yet.)
- The DDSes in the koma3 folder have the same name as the koma4 ones.
- koma2 D ...

Title: (WIP) CAS: Character Anime-Shading
Description:
This is basically a texture conversion mod which aims to change all the character textures to ones resembling the anime/bustups. This is a work in progress and a massive and time consuming project, so don't expect to see it finished anytime soon.

This mod does not change the models or the shader, only the textures. This mod therefore will never look perfect but in my opinion it is still an upgrade over the original visuals. In a perfect world this would be coupled with a texture mod that changes the environment to the same style.

Finished

â¢ Dojima

Working on:

â¢ Nanako

To do:

â¢ Almost everyone

Download includes:

â¢ finished Dojima (except for miscellaneous models like his flip-phone)
Nanako (only missing a couple of the lesser used outfits)

Don't mind the garbled Nanako model in the preview. For some reason when I export models with skirts with Noesis to quickly preview my texture changes, some animation bones are in the wrong places.

Title: (WIP) P3 Persona Restoration Project
Description:
THIS IS THE PROJECT PAGE. THE RELEASE/DOWNLOAD IS HERE

What is this?
When complete, this mod will faithfully restore every persona from P3/FES/P that was cut from P4G (~20) along with a bunch of cool extra features.

I was inspired by Blacklight's incredible P4G Ultimax Edition. There's a lot of QOL mods for P4G now, but I saw an opportunity here to modernise the game in a way that hasn't been attempted before and further close the gap between P4G and the newest games in the series.

My goal is for this to be a must-use mod for both new and veteran players, and one that expands the base-game seamlessly. :)

â¢ No existing personas will be replaced, only additions will be made.

â¢ Each new persona will contribute to the compendium completion percentage and have its own slot.

â¢ All new personas will appear in shuffle time where appropriate (obviously excluding ultimate personas like Orpheus Telos, Thanatos etc.).

â¢ All new personas without special fusions will follow the normal fusion ...

Title: (WIP) Persona 4 Rose Golden
Description:
I wanted to add a FEMC to the game, but why stop there? I decided that, with everything that comes with a FEMC, I might as well turn it into a full Atlus-style expansion/remake along the lines of Persona 5 Royal and Persona 3 Portable.

Current Plans:

An original, optional FEMC (who the team has lovingly named Yui Narukami/Somi Seta) with custom dialogue options, 3D models, voice lines, and possibly even her own animations (Although that depends on if the game will let me. If not, then she'll have a combination of Rise and P3 FEMC's animation.)

A custom Velvet Room Attendant for FEMC (who we've dubbed Walton at the moment. He's Margaret's opposite, like Theodore to Elizabeth.)

Male Romance Routes for the main cast. (Plus a bisexual route for one or all of the ladies, depending on the amount of effort it takes.)

and an optional Rose Gold recolor of the menus.

Possible Future Goals:

A new NPC with a full romance route

Additional Post-Conclusion Plot, similar to P5R's third semest ...

Title: (WIP) P5R Moveset Backport Project
Description:
I'm working to backport every skill from Persona 5 Royal that isn't present in Golden, in an effort to modernise the game faithfully with careful consideration not to affect difficulty/balance. I want this to be a straight-forward expansion to the game, not a complete re-working.

You can follow progress from the "To-Do" tabs here, or more closely from my project document.

Approach:

â¢ Expand the pool of learnable skills for as many of the 159 Personas that exist in both P4G and P5R as possible. Personas that exist in P4G but not P5R will not be touched (for now at least).
â¢ No skills should be removed or replaced from the base-game. Additions only.

â¢ The Arcanas of all personas should be left unchanged from what they are in the base-game. Same for resistances, fusions etc. Skill tree changes only.

â¢ Skill progression as personas level up should follow the established conventions/patterns already in place on a per-persona basis.
â¢ Any redundant or duplicate skills identified while e ...

Title: (WIP) [Outdated] Persona 420 Golden PC Port
Description:
THIS MOD IS NOW AT THIS PAGE. THE WIP WILL BE LEFT UP FOR ARCHIVAL PURPOSES.

If you've ever seen a P4 mod, there is a near 100% chance that you have heard of Persona 420. Well, a person ported that to Persona 4 Golden on Vita. I've wanted it on PC for quite some time now (since it came out) but there is a completely different file system, meaning I have to hand-copy textures hundreds of times, extract models, test stuff, match up and inject voice lines, etc. I wanted to document my progress here. If you're in the WIP section, you probably don't need an installation tutorial, so I'm skipping that in this post.

If you have any issues at all, please, please, please leave a comment, as I do not have the time to test a lot of things. If you find an issue, please tell me exactly what the issue is and where it occurred. I'll try my best to get on it.

Title: (WIP) P4A/BBTAG Alternate Colors
Description:
About
This will be a collection of skins for all Investigation Team members based on alternate palettes from Persona 4 Arena (including Rise) and BlazBlue Cross Tag Battle. For now, I'm only planning on creating the ones based on other characters (Persona legacy alts like P3/P5 Hero, Arc System Works legacy alts like Ragna and Ky, BBTAG castmate alts like Hyde and Ruby). I don't currently plan to do Personas or Adachi, and things like HUD portraits and status screen images are out of my range.

Installation
This mod will be set up to work with the Mod Compendium. I plan on having all the alts in a single download, since it's just textures. You'll be able to extract whichever alts you want for each character, with the paths already correct for extracting to the base folder.

Title: (WIP) P4G Music Manager
Description:
P4G Music Manager simplifies replacing Persona 4 Golden's music to just a few clicks! No messing around with command line or dealing with all the files. Just select a replacement song (.wav) for one (or all) of P4G's songs, hit Save then Create, and a new BGM.xwb file will automatically be created filled with the songs you've replaced. From there it's a simple copy and paste over P4G's BGM.xwb and you're ready to go!

News:
A new method for replacing music is now available through TGE's (big thanks!) p4gpc modloader (github.com) (steamcommunity.com)! This method doesn't require remaking the BGM.xwb, possibly multiple times, but does require setting up Reloaded II (github.com) with TGE's modloader and encoding files for use in P4G with a tool like P4G_PC_Music_Converter (github.com). First release will still use the xacttool method while I look into adding support for this new one!

Features:
â¢ Simplifies replacing P4G's music to just selecting files!

â¢ Replacing
multiple songs at onc ...

Title: (WIP) Discord Rich Presence for Persona 4 Golden
Description:
IMPORTANT: This project is currently on indefinite hiatus. There is a chance I may come back to it, however college and work have currently prioritized themselves in my life, and I don't have a ton of time for modding. Feel free to message me if you'd like to pick up progress on this! :)

I'm currently attempting to implement Discord rich presence into Persona 4 Golden. This is a brand new area for me, as I've not ever attempted to implement this into a game before. It may take a bit, however, it does seem to definitely be possible!

I'll post status updates as I progress through developing!

If anyone with more experience would like to help out or has suggestions, feel free to message me here, Twitter DMs, or on my Discord listed on my profile. :)

Title: The Genesis (Final Boss Theme) - Loop Fix
Description:
Introduction
This mod adjusts the final boss theme in Persona 4 Golden, "The Genesis" to make it loop seamlessly.

I've always disliked the original since it plays in full before ending abruptly and then starts again from the very beginning. This is too jarring to my ear, especially when compared to every other track in the game.

I made this version from my own uncompressed WAV rip of the song, so rest assured the quality is as good as it gets.

Preview (Spoilers)
Preview video below. This contains spoilers for the final boss of the game.

Track starts at ~1:35. If you're familiar with the original, you should be able to hear the difference easily. I've essentially removed the outro/"Reach Out to the Truth" section.

Title: Delicate Music Tweaks
Description:
Introduction

This is a small collection of music changes intended to enhance Persona 4 Golden for first-timers and veterans alike. Each track change is carefully considered, justified, and tested before being added to the collection.

Think of this as "Persona 4 The Faithful, But Even More Faithful." The goal here is not to create a "whole new listening experience" but to delicately add to an already top-tier soundtrack.

Changes and Explanations
I have made a Changes and Explanations document with a list of all the changed tracks and extensive explanations for each of them. Please note that the document contains unmarked spoilers for the entire game.

Title: Persona 4: The Faithful Music Pack
Description:
The Faithful Music Pack aims to create a fresh listening experience for Persona 4 Golden, using a combination of remixes and original songs from other Persona 4-related media. It is best suited for a New Game+ Playthrough or for those who would like a change of pace from the game's original soundtrack.

Features

â¢ Remixes and original songs from Persona 4 The Animation, Persona 4: Dancing All Night, Persona Q, and more.
â¢ Encounter music is now randomized and no longer dependent on whether or not your party has the advantage when entering battle.
â¢ Two new encounter themes from the Persona Q series have been added.
â¢ Unique encounter and boss music for late-game dungeons.
â¢ Unique boss music for Shadows of party members. (Full Version Only)

Specific changes can be previewed on this Google Sheets document.

Full vs. Lite
As of December 30th, 2020, there are two separate BGME Config Packages available for the Faithful Music Pack.

Title: Aria of The Soul SSBU (å¨ã¦ã®äººã®é­ã®è©©)
Description:
This is a simple sound mod to replace The Poem of Everyone's Soul in the Velvet Room to a more recent, upbeat and funky version from the game Super Smash Bros. Ultimate.

Installation Instructions for XactTool
Installation Requirements:

â¢ .NET Core Runtime 3.1.5
â¢ TGE's Music Replacement Tool (XactTool)

Injecting and Replacing Music in the XWB

After extracting the mod and XactTool into the same folder, open up the Command Prompt (Win+r, and type cmd.exe, and run). Navigate to the XactTool folder you were in by using the cd command. For example:

cd C:\Users\[Username]\Documents\xacttool

Once in this folder, simply type xacttool, and press enter to launch the program.

From here, we'll be following this template below to inject the songs properly.

xacttool -wb "D:\Games\Persona 4 Golden\SND\BGM.xwb" -r "Aria of the Soul (Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Version).wav" -ls 4694016 -le 17166334 -i 21
The index number refers to which song you're replacing in the game. In this case, 21 is the ...

Title: Classic Style Music Mod
Description:
Hey there! This is a mod to give the game a bit of retro-flare since Atlus made a special boss theme in a retro style but not the other songs. I even included a few other non-TV World songs since I was already putting this mod pack together. Either way you can enable or disable individual songs at your leisure.

Instructions are pretty simple. I do recommend the P4G Music Manager byÂ T-Pose RatkechiÂ so if you'd like: download and set that up.Â The Music Manager is how I was able to put this all together so my instructions will follow suit.

INSTRUCTIONS:

1) Download the Music Manager

2) Download RmanX Music Mod Pack

3) Open/Setup music manager

4) Use the manager to replace the songs you'd like

5) Make a backup of your BGM.xwb file located in your P4G PC files

6) Copy the new BGM.xwb created by the manager

7) Place that new BGM.xwb in the P4G PC files where the original one was

8) Boot game

Pretty easy, right? This has been something I've personally wanted since the original P4/P ...

Title: Nothing is Promised (Boss theme from Persona Q2)
Description:
I really like the boss theme from PQ2, so I tried to put in the game. This is my first time uploading a mod or setting up loop points. But when I tested it, it looped nicely. I'm not familiar with TGE's modloader and Mod Compendium method, but I included the raw files (replacing the main boss theme) if you want to insert it that way. However, I haven't tested it that way, and can't really help there if something goes wrong.

I used the xacttool method, since that's what I'm more familiar with right now. I hope either method works for you. The command for that is: xacttool -wb "{your steam games folder/[Day or Persona 4 Golden]/snd folder/bgm.xwb file directory}" -r "NothingIsPromised.wav" -ls 860160 -le 7208960 -i 3
For the mini boss theme, replace the 3 at the end with 47.

Title: Full Version of Time To Make History
Description:
Persona 4 Golden only loops the first verse of Time To Make History in-game. With the recent update to TGE's modloader, music mods are ridiculously simple, so I decided to replace it with the "Original Full Size Version" featured in P4D, which has the second verse and is currently the best "full" version of the theme that isn't also a remix.

This mod is structured to be compatible with the Mod Compendium. Just extract the zip file to the Mods\Persona4Golden\PC\ folder. There is also now a .wav version compatible with xacttool and P4G Music Manager.

Title: Persona Intelligent String Substituter
Description:
Intro
Batch replace words from .bf, .bmd, and .pm1 files from Persona 4 Golden and Persona 5. Useful for batch replacing names when you want to replace a character or even words to make funny meme mods such as fog to pog.

Prerequisites
.NET 5 Runtime

Usage
â¢ Select Input Path to be a folder containing the dumped files containing text
â¢ Select Output Path to be a folder where the input is copied and pasted then edited in place
â¢ Select which game's files you're editing as well as options to check for case sensitivity or the whole word.
â¢ Type in words you want to find in the top box and words you want to replace them with in the bottom box
â¢ Hit replace and wait. (Could take a long time if you're doing an entire dump)
â¢ Profit

Contribute
Feel free to contribute and make pull requests on the open source code.

Title: P4GMOdelConverter (pioziomgames ver.)
Description:
What is it?
It's an edited version of P4GMOdelConverter by ShrineFox.

What is the difference between this version and the original?
This version is focused on delivering as many useful features as possible. Things like: Auto Updates, Remembering Weapon Bone names and Material Values, Material Presets, automatically fixing broken Materials.

Complete list of new features with explanations as of version 1.0:

Dark Mode

Force Textures folder- when converting gmo to mds forces textures folder on all textures making models exported from the game perfectly working without any edits.

Weapon Bones rewrite - Weapon Bone option has been completely rewritten making it easier to replace battle models without breaking the weapons.

Texture conversion fixes - made the textures always convert

Reformat Bone Names fixes - made the option work for more models

Fix materials - An option to fix the materials during repairing of the mds making it a lot easier to get your model to be correct in the game ...

Title: Model Replacing tool
Description:
I have decided to upload this tool I've been using for my Less flat Characters mod.

Here is a summary of what it does

â¢ Path to the texture folder: this folder will have to contain the new textures you want to apply with the original name of the texture in .tm2 format (when replacing a model the material is the same as the original so you have to overwrite the original texture with yours), it's set to the texture folder in the tool when you launch it but it can be varied so that you can use multiple textures for different characters in different folders, putting too much stuff in this folder will only slow down the process but the results will always be the same because the model will only pick the textures that have the same name as the originals when compiling.

â¢ Path to the Input folder: here you'll have to give the path to the original .amd files you want to edit, do not use files that you already edited with this process because it could result in some errors.

â¢ Output1: here ...

Title: P4G Encounter Randomizer
Description:
Description
Easily create a patch that randomizes every battle.

Requirements
.NET Core 3.1 (Runtime)
Aemulus Package Manager by Weeb Tekka

Usage
â¢ (Optional) Open and edit config.json. Make any changes you want and save.

â¢ Run P4G_Encounter_Randomizer.exe.
â¢ If you see the message "Package successfully created!" then copy and paste the "Randomized Encounters" folder to your Aemulus Persona 4 Golden packages folder.
â¢ Enable in Aemulus and build when ready.

Config

By opening config.json in a text editor you can control some settings of the randomization.

BossShuffle (NOT RECOMMENDED)
Randomizes the order of bosses. Not recommended since doing so can crash the game and/or stop you from progressing. Default: false

MiniBossShuffle
Randomizes the order of minibosses. Default: false

OptionalBossShuffle
Randomizes the order of optional bosses. Default: false

MinEnemies
Minimum amount of enemies in any random encounter. Default: 1

MaxEnemies
Maximum amount of enemies in any random ...
